Reviews.Title: “Great location and everything you expect from a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Menippe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right next to Pacific Place shopping mall with DIRECT access where you can walk over to the Admiralty MTR. We took 2 Double with Mountain view and the view was quite good, with the view of the peak and could also see the swimming pool below. The room was spacious for four or five persons and had a study table, sofa and coffee table There is also free wifi in the hotel room and everything is replenished on a daily basis, such as the woven bag or even the pen! The gym is also well-equipped and there are also drinks available at the gym. Overall, it was a good experience but the only gripe is that there is no Tea restaurant (Cha Chan Teng), in Admiralty!!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What You'd Expect from a JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Nesher
Reviews.Content: This review is a few months overdue. My buddy and I were traveling to Indonesia and we decided to stop over in Hong Kong to do some shopping for our wives. The service was excellent and the room was awesome to say the least. We received an upgrade that made it possible for us to view the city at night as if it were a post card. What an awesome experience it was. We ate in the city as well as at the hotel. Transportation from the airport is very easy to and fro. We took the train into Hong Kong Island and a cab back to the airport when we decided to leave. You have to visit the street markets when in Hong Kong. We plan on returning early 2013 and this is the place to stay for us. The fitness facility is open 24 hours my buddy and I worked out for an hour and a half in the middle of the night after dinner and the equipment is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and customer centric staff.”
Reviews.Author: TravellbuggY
Reviews.Content: We had an absolutely wonderful experience at the JW Marriott HK. Being located on top of the Admiralty MTR was super convenient. The room was great and the service staff ensured that it was gleaming throughout our week long stay. The Concierge and Front Desk were very attentive and professional. Our 2am transfer from the airport was seamless and we were ushered straight to our room without having to stop for check in. The staff made our stay simply wonderful. Thanks and we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: pies1311
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on a work trip as our office is right near the Marriott. Fantastic room and amenities that you would expect from a hotel of this class. The room was large with good views of the city. The large Pacific Place mall is right next to the hotel. A colleague stayed at the Upperhouse next door to the Marriott and the Upperhouse is much better, albeit more expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: saber13
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located-near Pacific Place-well connected through the Admiralty MTR station and close to the vibrant Wanchai area. I stayed at the hotel only for one night but was quite impressed with the service though the room was just about fine as i had expected better considering the JW brand. The power sockets are hidden away and it takes a bit of exploring before you find them under a wooden panel near the writing desk, The hotel offers free internet and that is helpful. We had a nice meal at the Man Ho Chinese restaurant but had to skip breakfast as was running behind schedule. All in all everything works and the property is great for a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't think it was possible to beat the Conrad HK”
Reviews.Author: danherbel
Reviews.Content: But the Marriott did. Amazing executive lounge. Great service. You can't go wrong with this hotel. It is a bit out of the way, but taxis are so cheap in HK its not a big deal. You have to walk through Pacific Place mall to get to Admirality subway station, but its very easy to get around HK. Also if you are on the exec floor free food, drinks etc.. Great spot to relax or get some work done.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: JasonNyilas
Reviews.Content: As I arrived from a long haul flight I was shown directly to my room by a very friendly woman who made it easy for me to relax as soon as I entered the hotel. The express check in was just the first of many exceptional customer services moments I had here. The exec lounge is on two levels and has outstanding views of the harbour. For a hotel lounge, the food was exceptional in terms of the quality of the produce and the variety. One could save hundreds of dollars on food as breakfast and evening meals are excellent. The pool is a 20 metre affair in the open and I loved going for early morning laps amidst the surrounding buildings and greenery. There is a restaurant by the pool that has superb food and flows out into the open deck area. The gym is open 24 hours and equipped with new machines, new weights and very spacious. The room was modern, clean with everything you would expect. Compared to US and UK hotel standards, this hotel beats them hands down. The hotel is also located near Central, so right by the express train to the airport. A truly five star experience.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianJDK
Reviews.Content: Fit and finish of the hotel were well above the typical US standard. Rain showers, full marble bathrooms, great city views from all rooms. We used the pool and the gym, dined in the cafe and used the executive lounge. All were great; the lounge saved us literally hundreds of dollars in breakfast and happy hour stuff. Location was pretty good - it was a five minute cab ride to LKF and about a 20 minute ride to Kowloon for taking photos of the downtown. We stayed there on points (35,000/night) and we're glad that we did. We would definitely go back. Hotel is appropriate for tourists, families and business people.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location -- Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Pattoe
Reviews.Content: Spent one night during a layover in HK. Overall the experience was very good and I would recommend it for business travelers. The Good.... - The service, particularly at check in and check out, was fabulous -- it was 5-star, without reservation. - The Club Level was very well executed -- just what I look for -- good food and drink, not overrun by kids, quiet space upstairs -- WELL DONE, JW. - Close to the Airport Express (which gets you to Hong Kong Station from the Airport in 24 minutes), but with traffic, still a 15 minute taxi to the hotel (but only $5 US). - Good options within a short walk for dinner and shopping, including Mall access in basement of hotel. The not so good.... - Rooms are pretty cramped. - So of the decor is a bit out of date. Bottom line -- I would definately stay here again. They service is top notch and the Club Level is well done.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate, albeit dated”
Reviews.Author: RenMaKe
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with this hotel at all, and I do not wish to seempicky, but so many other hotels have upgraded their look and feel over the recent past and I felt that the JW Marriott still exhibited a 1990s style. Nothing stood out, and the experience was un noteworthy - just fine. The bathroom was festooned with dark marble, which made it a bit cave-like. However, all was perfectly clean, and staff in the rather uninspiring lobby (there is a great big firedoor right opposite the reception desk, never see anything like that!) were friendly and efficient. Predictable perhaps, perfectly adequate - I wanted to get these brief thoughts down before I forget my stay, it was that bland.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and breakfast - but that's it”
Reviews.Author: biztraveller012
Reviews.Content: Clumsy rooms and aircraft toilet sized bathroom is how sums up my experience of a standard room at this hotel. Breakfast buffet is however generous with an expansive spread and provided solace after my short stay at this hotel. Definitey there are many other better choices in Hong Kong than this one. The worst part was my interaction with a receptionist over phone who just couldn't understand English - can't expect that from a Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location away from the crowded place of hongkong”
Reviews.Author: belShanghai
Reviews.Content: we just cameback for 4nites stay at JW marriot.we stay at 2608 deluxe room which is perfect view as ive requested corner room,it was very lovey city view,,,since it was my husband birthday i requested birthday cake,and they even ask me what flavor of cake i want,,also theres a b.day card message from the manager.We definitely coming back on this hotel,very relaxing and convient after walking 2days for disney and 1 day at ocean park,,we always looking forward to go back in our room.My 2 kids love the swimming pool too,very clean room and efficient check in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Binal4
Reviews.Content: Given it is a large hotel, we didn't expect the level of service we got, it was amazing. From the moment we checked in to when we left we were impressed, and appreciated the fact that the gentleman who showed us to our room remembered our names, what our plans were and tried to help plan our day when we were heading out, asking how it was when we came back - it was a really nice touch. The hotel is lovely and in a great location, the rooms are great, and not too small, so you don;t feel cramped. We were lucky enough to get a room with a view of the Hong Kong skyline and enjoyed seeing a glimpse of the laser light show from there on our first evening. We didn't have breakfast there so cannot comment on that. It was a great place to stay during out trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Gemstone4ever
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is a superb hotel. The pool is great and the breakast is absolutely fantastic. The only thing I wasn't keen on was the live music in the bar in the evenings, but there is a quieter area too which has beatiful decor. I left my swimmng costume on the back of the bathroom door and there was absolutely no problem when I went to retrieve it hours after I had checked out. I will defnitley stay here again when next in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Wkhc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott for a week but it was a big disappointment. We lost a wooden hand crafted souvenir we bought in Beijing after my wife left it on the bed on day. I suspected that the maid must have mixed it up with the bed sheet and took it away. I reported that to them and they left me a message later saying that they couldn't find it. We search the whole room and out luggage and couldn't find it. When I followed up with them again to see if they have located it, they send the security to our room and moved the beds looking for it. They then proceeded to search through every inch of my son's luggage and wanted to start searching my wife's luggage when we stopped them. They made us feel like we are thieves when we needed them to located our lost item. They later sent a  bottle of cheap wine to apologize but my item is still lost and I did not expect to be treated like that by a 5 star hotel management. I asked to speak to the hotel manager but I only get to speak to the same assistant front office manager who came to search our room who insisted that they were providing us a service when searching through our belongings! A big disappointment!  Another problem is their thin walls. One night one of our neighboring room decided to take a bath at 4:00am. I am not a light sleeper but I got waken up by the noise that sounded like engine running. We were all waken up by the noise. One more thing, I usually enjoy using the gym at a hotel but their locker room stinks! So bad I only went to the gym once in the week we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy with a touch of elegance”
Reviews.Author: Markita F
Reviews.Content: Great location!! The hotel has several great features to include: a mall with high end stores, great restaurants and several lovely scenic views.The service is impeccable. The staff are accomodating and serve as really great host and hostesses. The beds are comfortable and cozy. The decor is very contemporary and chic. Staying at this hotel is a must when visiting Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Business or Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: ObjectiveRater
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights while on a business trip. The hotel was excellent and the rooms, service gym and food were just what I wanted. It is a hair dated in some areas, so it would be great to renovate so it can continue to compete with the other top hotels in HK. Overall, I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Services”
Reviews.Author: Tom R
Reviews.Content: Ideal location in Central Hong Kong, Luxurious rooms, very comfortable beds, and if shopping is your goal, just take the elevator down into One Pacific Place Mall where you will find a variety of high end shops. There is a sky bridge connecting the mall to other shopping areas across the street, so if the weather is too hot or rain, you never need to go outside to continue your shopping. Not too far from the Star Ferry and convenient to everything. An ideal location to stay when in Hong Kong. The hotel seafood buffet is excellent, and the staff goes out of their way to attend to your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Freqtourist
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January on the executive club level. It was wonderful. On arrival they provided tea service and each day we had fresh fruit. The club level had a two story lounge with a full breakfast with multiple offerings. All day long we had access to beverages, fruits, cookies and candies. The cocktail hour was really a full dinner. OK, that was enough gushing on the lounge. The hotel is conveniently located next to a large luxury mall and has a direct link to the subway. We were able to easily traverse Hong Kong without issue. The hotel's fitness center has what you would expect plus two saunas and a Jacuzzi. The locker room and showers had everything you would expect and more - shaving supplies, robes, slippers, etc. Our view of the harbor was stunning. The room was very well appointed and included toiletries including razor and tooth brushes. The desk even came with office supplies. The bath hadd double sinks, shower and tub, which we took full use of. They supplied a booklet on Hong Kong and a small canvas shopping bag we used to carry waters and things we bought. The staff are abundant and ready to help. The front desk can exchange money into HK dollars or RMG's at good transaction rates. They were very helpful with providing information on where to shop and directions to local attractions. If I could spend every holiday here I would. In fact I leave in three days to return to China. This time I will stay and the JW Shenzhen and will provide a comparison. I can not, however, imagine anything as nice as the JW Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Cold room.”
Reviews.Author: Luxury_traveller504
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice but not as elegant as other 5 star hotels in Hong Kong. The room had a decent size but again smaller than other 5 star hotels in Hong Kong. The room I had was far too cold for my taste. I were there in June so it was in the hot season and the hotel apparently had to much airconditioning on. I tried to turn off the aircon and I asked for a technician to look at it and nothing helped. I'm living in a warm country and I'm used to airconditioning but this was too much. I got a room next to the janitors closet and they kept me awake until 11pm and woke me up again at 6am. I could hear noise from the traffic outside even though i were on the 33rd floor. I'm a Marriott Gold Card member but was still not able to check in when I arrived at 1.30pm. I had the option to wait until 2pm or leave my luggage and come back later. Normal check in time is 2pm. I did not get a room upgrade altough I'm a Gold Card member. It is a benefit that is subject to availability - the only problem is that upgrades never seem to be available. As a Marriott Gold Card member I had access to the club lounge. It was very small, dark and noisy and didn't have the calm atmosphere I expect from a club lounge. The selections of food and drinks were reasonable. The restaurants at the hotel are very expensive - I'm again comparing with other 5 star hotels in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: bluefrog626
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott had wonderful and warm service. They really thought of everything including the nightly turndown service. The location was great - easy access to the subway station and the train to the airport. Also, great location attached to the mall for luxury shopping as well as restaurants. Also, we were able to walk to many attractions and restaurants. Rooms had great views and all the amenities. It was a great hotel for business travelers as well as leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable as always”
Reviews.Author: rajeevMumbai
Reviews.Content: The sheer efficiency of thsi hotel never ceases to amaze. Its just one very well oiled machine that chugs along well. Havign stayed here many times i am surprised that the level of irritants are so small and allow me to continue coming back here on an ongoing basis. The Mariott signature bed remains constant as does the good work by room service. The room service menu is a bit constrained for indian's compared to say the conrad next door but you can get along during a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stupendous Breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: mld1961
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hotel for 5 nights and once again the oriental service mentality showed through! the breakfast covered chinese, asian and western food - and included icecream! Rooms were well appointed an sufficiently spacious - although the bathrooms could have done with a bit of modernisation. Excellent location for high end malls and the metro the pool however could be a bit bigger - the pool at the sister Renaissance hotel is much larger - the Marriot pool had enough space for 3 swimming laps - for more a zig zag avoidance course needed to be taken

Reviews.Title: “Good central business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jon T
Reviews.Content: Good location for Hong Kong island, attentive service from staff. Outdoor pool that is a little small for the number of swimmers. Good choice of restaurants. Quiet rooms with all business services. Access to a wallet stretching shopping centre directly underneath!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and a great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Sri13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on work. Awesome service, seamless check-in, great rooms. Make sure to ask for harbour view. Perfect location. Very close to Lang Kwai Fong for the evenings. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel with some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: vacationer71
Reviews.Content: Recent four-day stay at the JW Marriott. Service was at the Asian prestige hotel standard, impeccable. The executive room was spacious and well-appointed, with particularly nice bathrooms. Widescreen television with good selection of HK and international stations. Very nice bedside control panels for lights and motor-driven drapes. Pacific Place location is fabulous for meetings at the Pacific Place or elsewhere in Admiralty, and via MTR or cab is very accessible to Central (but see note below regarding outbound cabs). WiFi was free (or, at least included) and was satisfactory -- although I note that as a US visitor I would not have been able to stream any media and can't vouch whether the WiFi is good enough for that. The club-floor suite provides a nice full breakfast everyone (once again, with good service) albeit with a fairly paltry evening-hour service (cocktails ending at 8:30 p.m., for example). Did not use the business center, fitness center, pool, or any of the hotel bars or restaurants. Problems? There were some. First, the hotel is unfortunately positioned right on top of Queensway and very close to Harcourt and a result the "better" rooms -- facing the Harbor -- are noisy even on high floors, and big enough truck / buses breaking / idling can cause a palpable vibration. The noise isn't intolerable, but is annoying. Until and unless the hotel installs strong noise damping in walls and windows, I'd strongly recommend requesting a "hill" or "pool" view, and as high a floor as possible, and staying at the Conrad or Island Shangri-La if only harbor views are available Second, the lobby is distinctively perfumed -- this trend is to be despised. Third, the keys had a tendency to "lose" their memory or not be encoded properly to begin with; twice in four days I had to have my key recoded. Fourth, the hotel seems to be set up quite poorly in terms of getting taxis: two different times I was in 15-20 minute wait for taxis in the lobby, which is unacceptable for HK. The Conrad, Shangri-La and Pacific Place Mall taxi-stands (all within 100 feet of the taxi lineup for the JW Marriott) each seemed to get their share of taxis first. This is something the concierge needs to work on.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and breakfast compensate for tired property”
Reviews.Author: jansumMacau
Reviews.Content: Overall, we found the JW Marriott great value for money; it was cheaper than most 5 stars in Hong Kong on the weekend we stayed. The location next to the Pacific Plaza Hotel is nice and central. 2 big positives for us, being exceptional service and the quality of the breakfast outweighed the fact that some areas of the hotel seem tired and in need of renovation. The pool area was quite average with cheap and old looking furniture and dated pool; if a pool is important to you there are other Hong Kong hotels with far superior pools such as Four Seasons and Grand Hyatt. The room itself was comfortable but the bathroom was dated and felt quite cramped. Whilst it was perfectly adequate the bathroom was not as luxurious as many of the newer hotels e.g shower area was small with a small detachable shower head and bath was on the small size. However, as mentioned upfront the positives outweighed the negatives. The breakfast was the best we have ever had on our frequent trips to Hong Kong; variety similar to most breakfast buffets but the quality was a big step in front; no barely warm food, reheated left over dinner dishes or tasteless egg powder scrambled eggs here! The made to order station for French toast was exceptional (also offered pancakes and waffles). The staff in the breakfast restaurant and the rest of the hotel were excellent. Overall, would recommend the JW Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: ppour
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were picked up in from the airport (offered a cool towel, water, welcome gift, mints and maps of the city) to the moment we checked out our experience was top notch! It's no secret that the hotel is not new, but it is well maintained. We were upgraded to a suite from a regular room (my husband is a gold member). When our Jacuzzi tub didnt work properly not only did they apologize and fix it immediately, a personal hand written apology was left from the manager, bottle of wine, cheese crackers, dried fruits and flowers to apologize for our inconvenience. The front desk knew we were staying for our anniversary, so when my husband ordered flowers and Champagne to surprise me one evening, they sent up complimentary chocolates as well! The view was great, the bed super comfortable and the staff kind and attentive. The concierge was glad to make all of our dinner reservations at restaurants around town and help organize daily events for us! Great location! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “"King Size Room”
Reviews.Author: Terikukis
Reviews.Content: Comfortable big bed, nice drapes n sheer, excellent view from the window. Bathroom in excellent condition and plenty of amenities ' loved the baths salts display'

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel Near Everything”
Reviews.Author: CJS07
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business and had a great experience. The rooms are a bit small, but have great amenities, are very clean and modern, with fantastically soft pillows and a great mattress. The bathroom is also quite nice and had JW Marriott's special toiletries which I enjoy. Hotel is located centrally, at Pacific Place so you can go to the mall or out strolling on Hong Kong island. Meals here were first rate, both room service which had a wide variety of options, and the dining rooms. Best breakfast spread I saw throughout Asia. Friendly staff willing to make reservations and recommendations for you, although beware it takes forever to get a cab when it rains....which is pretty much every day!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTraveler98108
Reviews.Content: So I stayed here for business trip and the JW Marriott did not disappoint. The staff were attentive and if I needed anything they were there to help. They had mutiples places to dine which gave me many options but it was also connected to the Pacific Place Mall. So if you want to some serious high end shopping... this is the place. The rooms were very nice. Spacious. The folks at the concierge were very helpful as well when I needed to find directions to The Peak. Overall it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JacqLJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed her in October 2011 with my husband and 2 children. Breakfast is stunning, expensive but faultless. It is a 5* hotel in the centre of Hong Kong so expensive - circa £500 a night bed and breakfast. Food and drinks are very expensive too but you expect that given its rating and location. Our rooms was spacious and well laid out. Large bathroom. Disappointing view to the back of the hotel and the block towards the hills behind Hong Kong but we weren't there much so not really a problem. Pool area is wonderful, a bit quiet which when you have children means you feel you have to keep them quiet but a lovely calm atmosphere and attentive staff. Really loved this hotle, I have given it 4/5 purely as I do think it is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for Business”
Reviews.Author: BrixNewYork
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business for about a week. The room was clean and modern and the location is within walking distance to a lot of the financial buildings and the bars in wan chai. I very much appreciated the extra technology including all necessary wires to connect your laptop to the TV (especially great for late nights with jet lag). An area of improvement would definitely be the room service menu - while it's large, a number of the dishes weren't very good. On a weekend late night, we were suprised to find out the bar closed at 10:30...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cpcervelo
Reviews.Content: Wow. This is one great hotel. The rooms spacious and nicely decorated. You get fresh fruit in your room daily. The staff is absolutely amazing. You are met with smiles wherever you go. When I got back from a run on a very hot and humid day, I received cold water and a towel. The concierge had a chat with me inquiring about my run. Quite nice. The location is also very convenient. The airport express train is a 3 minute cab ride away and tons of great restaurants and bars are within walking distance. I did have Sushi at the hotel which was amongst the best I have had in years. Highly recommend this place to business travelers and tourists.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate, Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: The JW is a great hotel in a location with easy access to the bus line and metro system. The hotel and rooms are well appointed with modern touches of luxury. The concierge lounge has a wonderful breakfast and view and the hotel restaurants are reaonably priced with high quality food. Enjoy a drink in the lobby lounge and enjoy a great view of Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - attention to detail and service is spot on”
Reviews.Author: stlanne
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several JW, Marriott and Ritz Carlton properties around the world and this flagship JW Hotel is remarkable. We stayed 8 nights. The staff is most attentive. The check in was speedy and flawless. All of the staff from bell hops, restaurant serving staff to concierge and more are wonderful and most helpful. Really, probably some of the most attentive of any hotel I have stayed. Always a warm smile! The lobby offers sweeping view of the harbor and skyline of HK - very impressive. The room was spacious. We actually had 2 different rooms as we wanted a mountain view and harbor view. One room was a bit bigger. The bed was VERY comfortable - the linens were top quality and wonderful. If you are interested in small details, you will love the little compartment in the bathroom with numerous ammenities. After a day of exploring I had a blister and found Band-AIdes and forgot my ponytail holders and sure enough there were some there! Razors with shaving cream, toothbrushes w paste, bath salts, and nice shampoo and hand lotion products etc... We are platinum members so we are fortunate to be able to use the Concierge level that is 2 levels with unforgettable views of the Harbor. A fabulous breakfast was available. wonderful teas, coffees and anything you can possible imagine! It also offers a "Tea time" - again outstanding food - lovely sandwiches/ scones etc.. Evening - happy Hour with wonderful assortment of wines, champagnes, cocktails and delicious food! We tried the Chinese restaurant there - Very good! We utilzed the concierge on many occasion and they were extraordinary. A previous reviewer said they were not veryt helpful to them - we found the opposite and we asked some unusual questions! I did wonder why there was no gift shop as well. That would be my only complaint. It is in walking distance of Hong Kong Park and I highly reccomend walking there and taking a walk and enjoying this oasis so close by!!! The metro and buses are so easy to use here as well and an easy to walk to get to both. I enjoyed the Yoga class on Saturdays - very good instructor. The pool is nice and they give you a cold wash cloth and a glass of water when you arrive! We went a couple of times. The gym is adequate. All the machines are new and in good working order...again the staff was most helpful getting you set up on the equipment! I look forward to returning here some day!!!

Reviews.Title: “Missing some of what's important to me.”
Reviews.Author: travels46
Reviews.Content: I agree that the staff is friendly. That said, My travel involves meetings that require a few needed components. First, I can't understand why a hotel like the JW Marriott has no on site gift shop. It connects to a large mall, but I don't need Tiffany, Prada, or any one of the other high end fashion stores that populate the mall. I need a gift shop that sells simple things like wrapping paper. Try finding that! Next, the Concierge is supposed to be the hotel problem solver. That's not the case here. When asked where I could buy wrapping paper the Concierge looked at me like I was from Mars, and was unable to help. Now, I don't want to sound as if the only important thing for most people is the ability to buy wrapping paper, but you may want to buy toothpaste, or something simple yet needed. Good luck! The rooms are ok but small. The Harbor view room I have has a bed with no backboard, but a bed level indent/shelf behind that makes sitting up in bed to watch TV or work difficult. The buffet breakfast is excellent, and about average in price for a hotel in HK. There are plenty of good restaurants in the hotel or connected mall. Then again, in a food paradise like Hong Kong, why eat in a hotel? I'm not keen on the location because it's a pretty good walk downhill from Pacific Place to anywhere, but cabs are plentiful and not that expensive. I've been to Hong Kong dozens of times before. I would not stay here again given the other hotel offerings in town.

Reviews.Title: “Back Again, and still great”
Reviews.Author: kkv1981
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW a few times. This time came back as a gold member, and stayed using my points. Really enjoyed the hotel executive floor and access to the club room etc. Plenty near by and easy access to the mall and MTR. Centre is just a few mins away by taxi. Great Location, Great staff and a great city. Pleasure to stay with you again

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating of our family”
Reviews.Author: BangkokDoc
Reviews.Content: Just had a three night family trip to Hong Kong and stayed at the JW. We had a good search around the hotels reviewed on tripadvisor, and finally chose the JW, one of the reasons being they were willing to accomodate our whole family of 4 in one room. This was not easy, as our kids are aged 6 and 10, and many hotels required us to book 2 rooms or didn't have beds big enough to fit us all. Two rooms would be okay if they were interconnecting, but some hotels couldn't guarantee us that either, so the JW was the final combination of the right room, price and location. We arrived having booked a room with a king bed with one extra bed, but they then offered us an upgrade (package, not free) to a harbour view room with 2 queen size beds, breakfast for 4 and a late check out. The price to upgrade was not cheap, but it ticked the right boxes for us definitely, as we had been a bit disappointed that we didn't have breakfast included when we booked online, and our flight home was late in the evening. The harbour view was a nice added extra, although it must be said that because of the hotel's location, the view is not a panoramic harbour view as such, quite a few buildings on the Hong Kong side in the way, but still nice. Overall we had a great time. The reception and concierge staff were all exceptionally friendly and helpful. My 6 year old "wants to stay at the JW a thousand years" because they gave them both a little teddy bear each. We enjoyed the breakfast for the quality of the products, notably the dim sum selection, the fresh raspberries and blueberries, as well as a smoothie/fruit juice combo station. Only thing my husband noted was he didn't think the quality of the fresh coffee was up to scratch, but made up for it when we tried fresh tea instead the next day and got a pot of tea with fresh tea leaves instead of a teabag. Everyone comments on the extremely convenient location of the hotel on top of Pacific Place, and we would second that. Our earlier choice of hotel was one in Wanchai itself, but this actually suited us more, as it's a quieter location but still very convenient. Being a bit lazy and having 2 tired kids traipsing around, we ate inside Pacific Place 3 times in 3 days, twice at Zen restaurant, once at Ye Shianghai. Excellent food at both places, but quite pricey too. I don't actually think the shopping at Pacific Place is all that exciting, but it's convenient enough to go to any of the other big malls. This was our first time at a JW property, but probably not our last.

Reviews.Title: “A great base to see Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: smjpfan
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I had stayed at the Marriott HK and it continues to be a great experience. I was upgraded to a harbour view room on level 16 upon check-in. Stayed for 4 nights on this visit, which was a holiday, and I have stayed for longer periods previously for business. The room was not large, but was very clean, had plenty of storage, was comfortable and luxurious, bathroom was clean and well equipt, bedroom had a big screen tv, internet, desk and Bose music system. The staff throughout the hotel are friendly and go out of their way to assist, including those in the fitness centre. The hotel laundry is right next to the fitness centre, which is handy after a workout (offering same day service). It is a big hotel, with many wonderful features. The food in the restaurants is great, and the hotel lobby a relaxing place for a coffee. Had dinner at the Man Ho restaurant (level 3), the service was excellent and the food very special. There was a prawn dish that came in a wasabi sauce that was exceptional. I would highly recommend heading in for a bite, but remember to book. I would recommend this hotel and will certainly stay here again on my next trip. Having the Pacific place shopping centre and rail directly below the hotel is a great convenience, so makes this a great hub. It is an easy (mainly air conditioned) walk through to Landmark or the IFC mall. The hotel helped organise bookings at some great very popular restaurants elsewhere in HK (such as Yung Kee on Wellington St) and even placed a order for a few of the famous local delicacies to get us started. As with any hotel in this range the room service is quite pricey. The in room safe is too small for a laptop computer. The fitness centre can feel a bit claustrophobic, it feels tucked away and the ceiling is quite low (there are no external windows), but that said it is clean, well fitted out and I went everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SAfan2009
Reviews.Content: If you're headed to Hong Kong, I highly recommend staying at the JW Marriott. The location can't be beat - right above the Pacific Place mall and the MTR Admiralty Station. I was in Hong Kong on holiday with my family and we found that we could get everywhere that we wanted to go on the MTR, so the JW Marriott is a great hotel for that reason alone. Our room was spectacular - we had a suite with a harbor view on the 31st floor that was nothing short of breathtaking. Everything was clean and in perfect working order and the room decor was elegant. The executive lounge had a great breakfast every morning that we took advantage of every day before setting off on our sightseeing tours. The hotel staff was exceptionally helpful in helping us get around town and made us feel very special. I hope I get a chance to return to Hong Kong in the future and I will definitely stay at the JW Marriott again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: ccandyy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel many times. Good location with Pacific Place Mall connected to the hotel and Admiralty MTR station in the basement level. Clean but rooms a bit small. Good gym.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel although could be easier to find main entrance”
Reviews.Author: MyopinionLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything - great food choice, accommodation and service. The only problem I had was when arriving fairly late and I went through the shopping centre - there were signs that pointed me to some obscure corridor which ended up being the entrance to a venue next door, so I had to go all the way round via the pavement to get to the main entrance. Otherwise, well equipped hotel with everything you need in the room - stationary, good bathroom products, free wi-fi, ipod dock.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: indoscot
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott, Hong Kong is located in the Pacific Place area of Hong Kong Island in Admiralty. The advantage of this hotel is its location. It is right where everything should be. Whether you're in Hong Kong on business or pleasure, this hotel doesn't let you down. The MTR (subway) is within the hotel, there is a super mall connected to the hotel and this complex also includes the Upper House Hotel, the Conrad Hotel, and the Shangri La Hotel. Tsim Sha Tsui is one stop away on the metro, and the SOHO district and the Central district are 5-7 minutes away in a taxi. The only downside I thought about this hotel was that the rooms could've been slightly bigger considering it is a JW Marriott, but I guess when you consider that its in Hong Kong, you don't mind too much. Otherwise, super hotel and I ordered room service one day and that was great too!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: chummyyummy
Reviews.Content: The service is excellent. As expected for a 5 star hotel. The room is compact and well equipped. They even provide a full set of stationary such as highlighter and paper clips. On your last day, a small token will be given out. For both my visit, I got a bath soap in nice packaging. The pool is a bit small though..but being a business hotel, hardly anybody there. Overall, the hotel still look good and new. Great location too with admiralty mtr connected to the hotel via pacific place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, classy rooms”
Reviews.Author: underock
Reviews.Content: Just above Pacific Place shopping mall and steps from Admiralty MTR, there is also a park nearby perfect for a morning jog. The peak tram is also just a short 15 min walk away. We stayed here for 4 nights and were upgraded to the club floor with access to the executive lounge which served delicious breakfast and evening canapés with a panoramic view of Kowloon Bay. Rooms were comfortable if a tad small ; If I remember correctly the Conrad and Grand Hyatt have slightly bigger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: LSF88
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with beautiful view of the harbor, but room is compact. The minute we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted by the friendly staff. The service at this hotel was excellent especially the concierge at the executive lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent visit”
Reviews.Author: simon06877
Reviews.Content: A great 4 day business trip. Everyone was warm and friendly. Great facilities in the compact room. Great location, exit the basement into the shopping mall with great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “2 night stay”
Reviews.Author: moobaby214
Reviews.Content: Booked a club floor room for 2 nights. Arrival at the hotel, I was met at the limo and taken directly to my room. Standard size room at the corner of floor 32. The bathroom was fine but I found the shower to be on the tiny side. The club lounge on the 33/34 floors was excellent. I had breakfast here both days with many choices both western and Asian. In the afternoon they have small sandwiches and other snack items. At night a variety of food, certain to keep most everyone happy. I used the health club one day. Plenty of good weights and equipment to get a nice work out in. The locker room had both dry and wet sauna's to use. As mentioned before the JW sits on top of Pacific Place mall. High end shopping with many places to dine. Overall I was very happy with my stay at the JW. The staff were outstanding and made you feel very welcome. The club lounge is one of the best I have been to anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great business location, amazing breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Marianne_A5
Reviews.Content: Great location, 30 second walk from lobby to One Pacific Place. Breakfast to die for, seriously worth a visit just for this. Bed was a giant, uber-comfortable marshmallow, wish I was there longer so I could lie in then linger over brekky. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: megatouch
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here for most of my last 5 years of visits in Hong Kong. I have never been disappointed. Service, food, and location are A+++++++++. MTR system (subway) and a top shopping mall are just an elevator's ride away. One of my most favorite hotels in the world, which has aged like a perfect wine, alwaying improving. Cheers and Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ...No bad surprises with Marriott!!”
Reviews.Author: Elyes B
Reviews.Content: Stayed in JW Marriott HK last week for 2 nights ...Very comfortable room with all facilities, nice view on the harbor ...No bad surprise at all! Very friendly staff always smiling ...Location is good - hotel is connected to a big shopping mall "Pacific" and within walking distance to WanChai -. Tried the Lobby Restaurant ...It was good! No comments! There were some works going on next to the hotel, I didn't even notice them!! Yes I would recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ct3408
Reviews.Content: My address in hong kong! Ok, I arrived annoyed due to confusing email exchanges attempting to reserve the conference space in the club lounge. As usual, however, the staff surpassed expectations from the moment I arrived at the airport limo counter until I checked out. Staff were helpful changing flights, bringing ice water at pool, taking care of shoe shine, and simply doing things with a smile. Great place, great club lounge, great location. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “A Good business persons hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ashley1542
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this week on a 4 day work trip and having stayed at the 2 neighboring hotels I would have to say in my experience this would sit at number 3 of the 3. Rooms were reasonable sized but were in need of a refresh as they are looking a little tired.I stayed on the 29th floor in a standard room so could not comment on the higher floors. The service was as you would expect from a 5* hotel, efficient and always willing to please.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Rosie6529
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is situated on the HK Island across the busy side of Kowloon. Location is everything since it is centrally located in the Pacific Place Mall and above the Admiralty Train Station (MTR). Although it was pouring rain when we arrived, the Hotel made sure that we were welcomed with a piping hot tea and a complimentary fruit tray just after we arrived at our room. As the Hotel is located within a shopping Mall, you need not get wet since everything you may need eg food, toiletries, clothes, supermarket were all within the Pacific Place Mall or a covered walking distance. The Buffet breakfast had a good selection of both local and western style breakfast. A very good way to start your day or holiday for that matter.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary for a young person”
Reviews.Author: comesgoes
Reviews.Content: JW Marriott Hotel Hong Kong is located on HK Island, you are clsoe to the subway station and can easily get anywhere. I only staid one night but the service was better than I have ever experienced in my life. Breakfast was also incredible, fresh fruit from all over the world and they would cook anything you can imagine. Rooms are rather imperial style but clean and with an excellent view.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT experience - some tips for first timers in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: NCHKCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at JW Marriott in April with our pre-teen kids. We have lived in Hong Kong before and chose this hotel for our first return visit. The hotel was revamped a few years back and rooms are still in good shape. Rooms aren't huge (typical for HK) but the rooms we booked had all the amenities you need - separate tub/shower in bath, small safes, electronic controls for lighting and drapes, mini-bar, DVD player, wireless internet, etc. etc. Beds are on firm side as preferred in this part of world, but us Americans still slept comfortably on them. Here are some tips about the hotel and why we chose it. First - if you're visiting HOng Kong for first time and want to stay on Hong Kong island, do consider this hotel. It usually factors into business travel plans, but was a great place for family too. The location is excellent - walking distance to central district - right on top of Pacific Place mall with great shopping, dining, Whole Foods type grocery - right on top of subway stop. Second - things clear out at this hotel most weekends, so rates go down and it's easy to use all the facilities. Pool and hot tub were nearly empty on Saturday afternoon. Third - we obtained the club level services, and feel it's worth it. Breakfast was the best food presentation - lunch and dinner are very light/limited. We ate breakfast in the lounge every day, and got snacks and drinks at other times. The view of harbour from lounge is fabulous. Fourth - the Fish Bar restaurant next to hotel pool is excellent for simple grilled fish. A bit pricey but a great casual experience. If you don't do club level, the breakfast buffet downstairs is also excellent, but also a bit pricey. We are Marriott Rewards members and the hotel really went all out to recognize that. The front desk staff was very helpful in making some adjustments to our reservation at check-in time, looking at our rewards account and determining best way for us to upgrade. In general staff was very attentive and provided great service.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: mamapapa64
Reviews.Content: Great hotel......a little 'out of the way' but we learned you can walk through buildings to get to the Star Ferry and other central business places..............Stay stayed on the executive floor that provided cocktails and appetizers plus breakfast each day - well worth the extra. Rooms very nice.....would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: Gbonez
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to from the airport – take the airport express train for $100 HK to Central where you can board the complimentary shuttle bus for the hotel. Staff meet you at the door of the hotel, show you to reception and your room. Check in was super fast and our room was ready despite arriving early. It was a corner room with a great view of the harbour. It is very very clean and has a separate shower, bathtub, comfy beds, nice linens, desk, chairs, TV with lots of channels and a DVD player, fridge, safe, and kettle. We did not have the breakfast nor use the pool. The shower head wasn’t the best but there’s good water pressure and plenty of hot water. Bathrobes are really soft and the bath products are plentiful. You can operate lights and open and close curtains from your bed. A/c and internet work very well. Night was silent. Daily cleaning and turn down service are good – a plate of fruit was left for us. Take elevator to bottom floor and you will find the entrance to Pacific Place. There is a great market in the bottom floor and an MRT station within walking distance. Escalators from the mall go up to the Hong Kong Park which is nice to roam around. There’s a tea museum with interesting art pieces to see. We had the tea buffet at the Marriot and the traditional tea at the Peninsula in Kowloon and Marriot’s was by far the better deal and better food. Concierge team are extremely helpful and gave us great directions for Macau, Stanley market, Peak tram and the Symphony of Lights. I have to be honest; we were a bit disappointed with the light show. After seeing Robert LePage’s light show in Quebec City, this show was a let-down (for us anyways). A day trip to Macau and a morning spent at Stanley are worth the effort. We used Marriot points so we felt this was a fantastic place to stay: view was great. location was great, staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: azechan
Reviews.Content: We spent a few nights at JW Marriot and booked into the executive level which gives you access to the executive lounge. The room is a tad smallish in my opinion and I didnt really like the lobby which lookds a wee too tired and jaded for me. Its also rather noisy. The pool was again smallish and nothing to shout about. But the lounge is superb and worth all the money. Spread over 2 levels, it gives you splendid views of the Hong Kong harbour day and night. The lounge serves some of the best snacks all day long and you can have your breakfasts there too. However we find the breakfasts to be rather boring after a few days as they basically serve the same thing over and over again (this is a grouse I have with all Marriot's properties). We never tried any of the restaurants in the hotel- the best and inexpensive food can be found outside the hotel! As far as location is concerned, it is located within the Pacific Plaza place (where you can find a good Lane Crawford interior shop) and the MTR is just a few steps away so its very convenient. IFC is not too far away either.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the JW Marriott Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: HeyMan76
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Hong Kong in the past 8 months. On my first visit, I stayed at the Grand Hyatt Hong Kong. I preferred the location of the JW Marriott over the Hyatt. It's more central than the Hyatt which is located next to the convention center, The Marriott is located within the Pacific Place complex of shopping, restaurants and other hotels and is directly connected to the MTR at the Admiralty station which makes using the MTR extremely convenient. A tip however when using the Airport Express train is to get off at the Central station (last stop), and take a taxi to the hotel. While the you can transfer at Central station between the Airport Express and the Island Line to get to the JW, it's a long walk and you may find it difficult dragging luggage with you. I prefer taking the train over a car service or taxi. Not only is it much less expensive, you can get from the airport to central station in 22 minutes. It can take 45 minutes to an hour or more depending on traffic in a car. We arrived at the JW at 9:30 PM after a 17 hour non-stop flight from EWR. I had booked a three night stay using points. I'd suggest if you have them, this is a good hotel to use them in. The lowest rate listed on their website during our stay for a standard room was $600 USD per night. Being a Platinum Elite member of Marriott, our stay also included access to their Executive lounge. The thing I really enjoy about staying at Marriott's or Renaissance hotels internationally is the Executive lounge and The JW Hong Kong has one of the best I've ever been to (and I've stayed at a lot of Marriott's). The difference between domestic and international lounges is night and day. First off, they are open 7 days a week, not just weekdays like domestic locations. They also have longer hours. Generally between 6AM and 12 midnight. The (full) bar in the evening is complimentary as opposed to the limited honor bar at domestic locations and the food presentations throughout the day are wonderful. Again, if your a Marriott Gold or Platinum Elite member, access to the lounge is included as part of your Elite status although anyone can pay to access the lounge and I certainly consider it if I weren't an Elite member. Even though we arrived late, our room was not yet available. We were escorted to the lounge to wait and within five minutes, the concierge in the Executive lounge handed us our keys to an upgraded, harbor view suite (another perk of being a Platinum Elite member). The room had a living room/dining room combination with a large, built in flat screen HDTV. A large separate bedroom with desk and another built in flat screen HDTV and a bathroom that was a bit on the small side with a Jacuzzi tub, separate shower but only a single sink. But that was the only downside on an otherwise very comfortable room. They even had live goldfish on the dining room table! The JW Hong Kong has a very nice gym and spa located on the bottom floor of the hotel. All the equipment looked new and the gym space itself was very attractive. The locker rooms (both men's and woman's), reminded me more a Vegas spa than a business hotel. Wood lockers, steam room, sauna and whirlpool. The gym is a bit on the small size given the fact that this is a 600+ room hotel so it can get busy, especially in the early morning hours. But it is open 24/7. Besides the Executive lounge, we only ate at the Fish Bar and Grill which is located next to the rooftop pool. The restaurant is casual and open air and the food and service were excellent. Being that you're in the heart of Hong Kong you literally have thousands of choices when deciding where and what you want to eat. The food is one of the best things about coming to Hong Kong. The JW Marriott is a great place to stay when visiting Hong Kong and I plan to stay here on future trips to the city. Every staff member we encountered could not have be friendly or more helpful. If you have any questions about the hotel or what to do or how to get around, don't hesitate to drop me a line.

Reviews.Title: “I always stay here when I visit Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: theorchidlady
Reviews.Content: The title of my review says it all. In my opinion this is one of the best hotels in Hong Kong, but more importantly, its location is superb. Located on Hong Kong Island, this hotel offers everything you need. First, it lets out directly into the high end Pacific Place Mall, and it sits directly above the metro. This means you can get anywhere in the city fast and easily by stepping down to the metro. While cabs are available, there are many times during the day when the metro is much faster and easier to get and if you want to go to Kowloon, the metro is a MUST. Second, the mall offers a range of eating options, from inexpensive, wholesome breakfasts at reasonable rates, to one of Hong Kong's best Chinese restaurants. It also lets you out onto the elevated walkways which allows you to walk to most of the buildings in the area without even crossing a street. The hotel has absolutely top-notch service, from the front desk to every staff member I met. They even have someone to open the exterior doors for you. The rooms are unique in design and layout, offering stunning views out of panoramic windows covering 2 walls of each room. You even have electric switches to open and close the curtains (either the blackout curtains, or just the sheers). It has gorgeous granite and stone tile bathrooms. This just doesn't get much better, even the lobby is absolutely stunning. This is the Marriott you have never seen before! Definitely Go and see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but glad I didn't pay normal price”
Reviews.Author: boisern
Reviews.Content: A family member works for the Marriott chain so we are able to get discounts at most Marriott properties. We got an amazing deal on a room but the room was surprisingly small. As far as I can tell we had one of their standard rooms. Of course it was clean and well decorated as one would expect from a high-end property. The bed was not very comfortable, as is per usual for Asia, but we have found most 5-star hotels here have had much better beds. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the hotel is in a great area. Pacific Place is right next door which is a very up-scale shopping area with many good restaurants with pretty high prices . The Admiralty MTR station is a walkable distance through indoor passages with easy access to most MTR lines. If you have never been to Hong Kong, the MTR (subway, tube) is very clean, new and safe. I suggest getting a "Octopus" card which you pre-load that makes going on the subway and light rail trains a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Location”
Reviews.Author: NEProp
Reviews.Content: Spent this past weekend in Hong Kong for the annual Rugby Sevens tournament and used points to stay three nights. My request for a harbor view room was granted (I am a repeat guest of this property) and it was on a high floor which is key as there is construction on property closer to the harbor, but the noise can be heard. The club lounge access is a super benefit - great breakfasts and dinners, with menus that change daily along with two floors of tables with terrific harbor views. The gym is very good by hotel standards and has everything one could really need. The outdoor pool is heated and offers a respite from being inside too much. Rooms are small by western standards, but you are big enough and when you take advantage of all the hotel has to offer from other space, then it is not a big drawback. Will continue to stay here when in HK.

Reviews.Title: “very, very nice”
Reviews.Author: AlgarveSunman
Reviews.Content: this hotel kindly let us book our whole family into one room, 2 adults & 2 children aged 14 and 12, we couldn't have afforded 2 rooms. The staff were lovely & friendly & explained everything; the room was a good size & had great views, a lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but ....”
Reviews.Author: Amits
Reviews.Content: Second stay here - three nights this time on business. The hotel is very nice just like the last time I stayed here. The service standards and basic quality of the hotel is very high and overall a very impressive experience (please see my review of last year). I was asked about my last stay at the reception with my kids and was given two small teddy bears to take back for them. A very nice gesture which my kids absolutely loved. The breakfast was as nice as the last time and found the tall helpful chef from the last time who was as usual good with tips on things to do and places to eat etc. However this time I also have some not so nice comments. The room I got this time was a little noisy - the toilet sanitation of the room or rooms (couldnt tell if it was becasue of one or two) adjacent to mine made a lot of noise which got me up sooner than I would have other wise in the morning (on an average starting 5 30 am). Got an opportunity to use the gym this stay - has a number of machines and equipment but was a bit disappointing compared to the rest of the hotel. I thought that the hotel is not as vegetarian friendly as my experience last time. May be things have chnages in teh menu since. Overall an excellent place to stay in HK

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Barbara J
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Hong Kong and I couldn't have picked a better place to stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. The food in the restaurants was great. My room had an amazing view and was immaculately clean. It's Hong Kong, where space is limited, so don't expect a huge room. However, there was room for a king-sized bed, desk and a comfy arm chair. The hotel is conveniently connected to a huge mall and is only a few minute taxi ride away from the financial center.

Reviews.Title: “true luxury living!”
Reviews.Author: emma t
Reviews.Content: theres not a bad word i can say about this hotel, well worth a visit!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorites!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller550
Reviews.Content: The hotel, the view, the rooms, the staff, the executive lounge, and the location are all top notch! If you read all my hotel reviews, you'll see that I've had a real love-hate relationship with Marriott's' these past few years. The JW in HK is how I remember them, (And how many in the US should become. I can't think of a thing I'd change.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property in a Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: ilovebali18
Reviews.Content: We arrived into Hong Kong, took the airport train to Hong Kong, and then a taxi over to the hotel. Upon arrival, we went up to the Executive Lounge for our check-in. Everything was smooth and efficient. Afternoon tea was about to come to an end and so were the most decadent and delicious tiny chocolate fudge tarts! The person cleaning up noticed that we were impressed with the taste of the goodies and, without asking us, wrapped up the rest of them and gave to us! The lounge concierge told us that we would have a concierge floor level room without a view and we were disappointed, so she found us a mid-level room with a view which made us very happy. If you are in Hong Kong, you should always get a harbor-view room, especially if you are staying on the Kowloon side, which was not the case on this visit. The room was gorgeous, but not overly large, with every amenity you could imagine. The corner rooms are larger, but we did not get one on this trip; we were happy to get our view which was indeed spectacular. Years ago, when we first stayed at this property, it was a Marriott and then, eventually, it was re-branded within the Marriott family to its JW name and status. The hotel exceeds the JW Marriott standards. The outdoor pool is wonderful and opens at 6 am for the lap swimmers. It is glorious to be in the middle of the city and be able to swim in such a great pool. Actually, for pool lovers in Hong Kong, the pool at the Renaissance Hong Kong is even larger and grander ! The selection and quality of food in the executive lounge is among the best at any Marriott lounge worldwide and will dazzle even the fussiest person's tastebuds and eyes. The service is excellent and the staff is there to truly please. The hotel connects to the Pacific Place Mall which is very nice. Don't forget to go Hong Kong Park which can be reached by escalator from the mall; the park is a magnificent oasis in Hong Kong complete with gardens, walking paths, a greenhouse, and an aviary. The JW Marriott Hong Kong is now my Hong Kong home!

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong was dull and dark, the hotel was not”
Reviews.Author: Stephen_Lloyd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights with work and Hong Knog was at it's most wet and miserable for all that time. THe locals were clearly wrapping up and feeling the pinch. Fortunately the reception given at the hotel was warm, with very good service and a large comfortable room complete with a good shower, work facillities and internet. I particularly quote the internet as many hotels have a login screen before you can actually get on lie, which prevents my clients VPN working. No such problem here and it allowed me to work late or on Sunday in the room when I could not get into an office. The other pluses were lcoation, over the Pacific Place shopping centre with some good eating places, and the hotels own Chinese restaurant on the 3rd floor. That was outstanding, both in service and quality of food. It certainly competes with the nearby Conrad, and is perfectly located for th Peak and Wan Chai areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fanastic service and dining!”
Reviews.Author: Mark G
Reviews.Content: Great service right from the moment we landed - limo pick-up (highly recommended) takes you directly from the airport to your room bypassing the check-in desk and makes all the difference after a long flight. Rooms very comfortable, well presented with great views of the harbour (a must when in Hong Kong). We had a very nice meal in JW's California and Jordi Villegas's signature dish of suckling pig deserves the accolade! We would also recommed the breakfast and lunch buffet - both are of a very high standard and with almost too many choices. The bar was also a very nice place to relax, with good cocktails and live music. Location is very good with direct access to Pacifc Place shopping and the MTR station. The Star Ferry is also walkable (10-15mins). Hong Kong Park is just behind the hotel and provides easy access, very tranquil and the best way to go for the Peak Tram. Visited the outside pool area (which we didn't get a chance to use) - but looked like a very nice place to relax amongst the skyscrapers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel, great lobby, rooms showing a bit of wear”
Reviews.Author: travelrabbit2003
Reviews.Content: We had to book a hotel room when we unexpectedly had to spend an extra night in Hong Kong, and chose the JW Marriott, given its central location in Hong Kong, and good reputation. We had also stayed in the Hotel ICON (in Kowloon), and comparatively, this hotel is starting to show its age. The room was clean and comfortable, but not very modern--and there was paint flaking off from the bathroom ceiling. We had a view of the Harbor, but it looked like they might be building another skyscraper in front of the Marriott, so I'm not sure how it will affect the view. However, we did like that the lobby is grand and bustling, and the pool is a relaxing oasis in the midst of all of the tall skyscrapers of Hong Kong. The service fantastic, but there are so many wonderful hotels in Hong Kong, it likely won't be where we'll stay when we return to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “5* classic”
Reviews.Author: edpi
Reviews.Content: Ok it is JW marriot, 5* classic hotel, great service and amneties. Located on pacific place, at the edge of wanchai and a bit of central. Good for business trip, then pricey!

Reviews.Title: “Good all rounder”
Reviews.Author: skingo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip. A step down from the mandarin obviously, but a good solid choice. This is well positioned for central. The rooms are good and spacious. There is a nice outdoor restaurant by the pool which is a good size.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that exceed my expectations”
Reviews.Author: cmice
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to stay in this hotel at Admiralty. We spent 11 nights in the spacious room with mountain view (although it was not the ocean view but no complaint). Room is clean and comfortable. My wife loves the nightly turn down service and the amenities. I especially like the hotel offer free wifi which is fast and easy to access (Compare to the Harbor Grand Hong Kong where i previous stayed, they charged the wifi access by DEVICE. I still found it's ridiculous). The location of this hotel is also very convenience, with bus terminal and MTR nearby and many good restaurants to choose from. We will definitely go back to this hotel when we visiting Hong Kong again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Superior Service”
Reviews.Author: AndyCzi
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay and we loved the four nights. Rooms are quiet and comfortable with separate bath tub and shower. Nightly turn down service which also replaced used towels, etc. is a nice perk. The breakfast buffet is very generous. Wireless service is good and easy to use. The desk was very comfortable for work and the views are urban but interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Quick stay after a long flight”
Reviews.Author: jonezy
Reviews.Content: This is a brief review of the JW Hong Kong our first stay at this property. We just finished a two night stay on points standard rate. Arriving late, around 10pm, and tired from a 16 hour flight, our only expectation was a standard room to clean up and get some rest. We were treated to an exceptional checkin and escorted to our upgraded room. The room was stellar and had a large spa tub. The room also had a pair of live goldfish on our table for company. About 10 minutes after arrival a pot of tea was delivered. Im sure part of this great service is being in asia but the JW seems to raise the bar. I should note that we have status with Marriott which may have r esulted in the upgrade The concierge lounge had a great variety and was open from 6:00am until midnight We would recommend the JW without hisitation

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel in central”
Reviews.Author: flightlevel36
Reviews.Content: Second stay in the recent past. Predictable good product. Comfortable rooms with updated technology - large lcd TV, fast wireless, accessible charge points, electronic light and blinds. Small bathroom, weak shower with small head. No pillow top mattress. Very courteous staff. Morning breakfast buffet was good - typical of a JW. Cost was on the higher end though. Will stay here again given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “A surprisingly good Marriott experience in HK......”
Reviews.Author: patrick_hogan
Reviews.Content: Knowing the "JW Marriott" from the U.S., I was a little anxious to find that this was the only hotel available on a recent business (w/e) trip to HK. I should have known that Chinese service would show through and I'd rate this hotel comparable to the other Pacific Place hotels such as the Conrad, Shang etc. Room was clean and spacious with a harborview, the cleaner was chatty and friendly and offered additional fruit. The healthclub was comfortable and well equipped and the staff were very nice indeed. Access to the shopping treats below in Pacific Place was easy and convenient. When my wife felt tired on the Sat, they extended our checkout till 7.00p.m. with no extra charge, unusually considerate. Priced at a significant discount to nearby hotels incl the boutique "upper House" next door but with comparable service, this is a bargain (!) among HK hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you'd expect from a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: voyageur à paris
Reviews.Content: The standards of service at this property are impeccable. The staff are omnipresent and efficient, although somewhat impersonal. The rooms themselves are showing their age, and could stand a face lift. While very functional, the carpeting was a bit tatty and the a/c system made enough noise to be annoying, but luckily it was winter time so there's really no need for the ventilation at night. The bed was very comfortable - plenty of big pillows and fresh linens every day. The bathroom, while on the small side, was well equipped. Overall, this hotel is very functional. It was fine for a business trip, but I would want something more spacious and homey were I travelling for pleasure. The hotel restaurants over a wide range of cuisine, and each was very good. The Asian soup bar in the lounge was fantastic, as was the breakfast buffet. The gym facilities are so-so, located on a lower floor with no natural lighting. The overall ambiance of the facility is claustrophobic, but again it is functional. I particularly appreciated the availability of TRX equipement, which one rarely finds in hotel gyms. I'd return to this hotel given its convenient location and standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MenVacances
Reviews.Content: We had a great time enjoyed the pool, the rooms are really nice and we loved the Chinese restaurant. We couldn't try the buffet for diner which was fully booked weeks in advance but the breakfast buffet was 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Marriott for 4 nights following a two week cruise from Singapore. The staff was some of the best we have ever experienced in our many travels. The location is minutes to the park and it is possible to access the Pacific Place shopping mall from the hotel. This turned out to be a godsend for us as the weather was terrible during our entire stay and the people watching in the mall was free cinema. The fact that the hotel is not closer to other (more interesting?) parts of the city was not a drawback. Taxis in Hong Kong are very inexpensive and the drivers are very knowledgeable. Our room was located on the 25th vloor over-looking the harbor. It was small for two people with two large bags. I agree with the comments of another guest who suggested there was too much "stuff" on the counters in the bathroom. Perhaps the hotel could place all of those boxes in a drawer or closet. The selection of tv channels with US news or international sports (the Australian Open was unavailable on Marriott tv's) was dismal! Having said that, stays at other Marriotts in foreign venues suggests that this is a consistent theme with Marriott. If you like Cantonese food, we found the restaurant to be quite good with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hospitality, Views, and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: GreatSleep
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights (2 rooms). Although the rooms were on the smaller side, anything we needed was provided within our living quarters. There were so many elegant touches and great amenities. The service was beyond all - and the JW pride was visible throughout the entire staff. We loved the people and hospitality at the JW Marriott. It sure made our trip to Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “World's smallest rooms at a high price”
Reviews.Author: robertli1234
Reviews.Content: I was shocked at the small size and odd shape of our room at the Marriott. The bedroom could barely hold one king-sized bed, and the hotel stuffed in an unnecessary chair/ottoman to let you know that this was a luxury hotel. The bathroom, also small, was cluttered with unnecessary boxes and bowls on the sink to achieve the same effect. The entranceway was L shaped, making delivery of a room service cart nearly impossible, particularly because the only place to open a suitcase was along the path. All this for only $400 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: MJZ154984
Reviews.Content: We had absolutely fabulous experience at this hotel. Our room was spacious (enough for 2 adults and 2 kids), bright, the bathroom was big, the view is great. All staff is super helpful. Perfect location, close to everything. Hotels just cannot get any better. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SalemX
Reviews.Content: We started our trip at another hotel which we did not like very much, on our second day there we passed by JW and thought we'd pop in and ask if they had availabilty. Luckily they found us a room. We were ecstatic!! The room was perfect! It had a nice view of the mountain and pool plus the location was perfect, it was above pacific mall and so we had close access to the MTR. We enjoyed our trip to HK and largely because of this hotel. Rates may be a bit high but if you manage to find discounted deal its well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the 3 hotels at Pacific Place...”
Reviews.Author: twinklemelody
Reviews.Content: JW Marriot often ranks the lowest amongst the three amongst business travellers. If you compare the size of the room , this may be true. However, having stayed at all 3 on various business trips, I find the hotel cosy and service somewhat more personalised that Shangri-la and Conrad, both of which are located within Pacific Place. I like the spacious bathroom and nice tolietries at the Conrad; high ceiling of the lobby and range of restaurants at the SHangri-la . But when you are on a business trip and pressed for time, the taxi lines at Marriot makes the difference - they move faster than those at Conrad and Shangri-la.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: egp1
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is in an excellent location connected to Pacific Place Shopping. The hotel also has easy access to Metro, buses and trolley. Easy walk to Central. The executive lounge is outstanding, service and food. Have stated there two times and next time in Hong Kong, this is my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: CROR
Reviews.Content: Spent Christmas and New Years in HK and the Marriot was the perfect place to stay. Needles to say the hotel in its entirety was spotless and the staff extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was beautiful, as was the japanese restaurant. The location is perfect, situated right on top of admiralty tube station and a 5 minute ride to the ferry. Recommend this hotel any day - would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good in a dependable way”
Reviews.Author: labrt2004
Reviews.Content: I had a good, standard JW Marriott experience here. We were here on New Year's Eve, when every hotel room in Hong Kong was booked, so I felt lucky that I even had a place to go! There was nothing terribly interesting about this hotel. International business types seem to be its target clientele, so it was surprising that English was very uneven among staff. We stayed on the Executive Floor, which has plenty of amenities. The executive lounge was a godsend and has s decent cocktail and dinner spread included in the price of your room. I especially liked the steak tar tar. Beware, the regular king rooms are very small. I called downstairs to have portable bed placed in our room and was told they had run out. I gave them a bit of temper, but didn't pursue it too much, since it WAS New Year's Eve and all, and things were bound to be bonkers all around. I settled for having a little mattress type thing brought up by the housekeeping staff. They laid it on the floor with some bedding.
