I thought having the channel guide printed on a bamboo scroll was slightly bizarre and probably too much kitsch. The elevators were more annoying than usual--since they use this weird electronic key instead of key cards, I was constantly fumbling with mine to try and insert it into the keyhole so I could access my room. The location and views are good. Convenient to walk to the city center and the ferry. We got an excellent glimpse of the fireworks. The turndown service the first night was a nice touch--warm tea in a cute carrier. Nothing very extraordinary, but still a solid place.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasure....”
Reviews.Author: SarahMckSingapore
Reviews.Content: Last time I stayed in Hong Kong it was a less than pleasurable experience, but my 3 day business trip at the Marriott was the exact opposite. I felt welcome from the moment of my arrival, unfortunately close to midnight on a rainy Sunday. The staff were polite, professional and attentive. In addition to checking me in, the young man on the desk signed me up to the loyalty program and took me to the lift and selected my floor. My bags arrived mere moments later and this was quickly followed by some complimentary Chinese tea and fruit; the tea was a lovely antidote to the trip. Every interaction from then on was spot on, right up to the moment of checking out, when the front desk person genuinely enquired whether I enjoyed my stay. The answer was an emphatic yes. I only ate breakfast at the hotel and it was lovely. I didn't use any other services, but the rooms were spacious and very well appointed. The amenities were great and I made good use of the free WiFi. The hotel is in a great office / shopping complex and well serviced by taxis. It's is a relatively short cab ride to the international check-in at IFC/Central and close to Admiralty MTR. I hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Ok lah”
Reviews.Author: RatmanKL
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor should introduce a "good" star. This hotel is good, not very good. Good location on top of a posh shopping mall, great staff, good if pricey restaurants. Rooms are smallish but well equipped. Bathrooms are dated. Club floor is nice but the opening hours for snacks and drinks are not very generous. Otherwise no complaints but definitely no "wow" factor. Marriott's plus is their great loyalty program and the free Internet access they introduced for all members. They do deserve credit for that. Otherwise it is obvious that it's hard for the Americans to compete with Asian chains such as Mandarin Oriental or Shangri-La for the pole positions.

Reviews.Title: “This is a true luxury hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Henri56
Reviews.Content: After Thailand it was good to be back in a country where the chain hotels know how to do hospitality. JW Hong Kong is blessed with a great location on the metro line, the rooms have great views of the bay, and the food is very, very good. Rooms are a bit on the small side but the beds are amazingly comfortable and we were even impressed by the TVs – 42 inch – and we don’t even watch TV. Internet is blazing fast and free. The Man Ho Chinese restaurant served some of the best Cantonese we have ever eaten and in this hotel you can be sure what you are eating is from the same species it is supposed to be, unlike many of the local restaurants around town where they serve and eat just about anything from the tree of life. The wine selections are huge and very reasonably priced but we found the wine bar to be a little too sterile in design for our taste. The fitness center is amazing; very well equipped. This is a true luxury hotel. You stay here you feel like a Goldman Sachs bankster with money to burn all the time. But, speaking of money, this is Hong Kong not Walmart, so be prepared to pay. Really work the deals in advance to get the best price then enjoy this hotel. Its hard to get bad service, food or sleep here and the staff are respectful, helpful and smile.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brijesh_Mitra
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights on a business visit. Quite like the hotel. It located in central hong kong. Rooms were very nice with 2 full glass walls. This gives the rooms a sense of space. Pool is nice. Food was good in the buffet. Over all a nice experience

Reviews.Title: “Good but not perfect...”
Reviews.Author: slao
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Jan 1 for 2 nights as a break from a busy season. Had requested during reservation and check-in for a high floor, double bed room with extra towels. I was given room 921. 9th floor for a hotel that has rooms up till 30 plus floors is definitely not a high floor. Sounds from the street like honking of cars can be heard. Since I was in a hurry (my flight was delayed by 2 hours), I did not bother to change room. A nice touch was the corner room, tea service and fruit platter. Would come back to this hotel, but I hope the next time I check in, requests would be considered.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. Base to Explore Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Papad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my family of 4. We stayed on points. The rooms are extremely small. They gave us a harbor facing room due to my husband's platinum status but it was nothing special. We did had a view of the victoria harbor and the light show that Hong Kong is known for. The breakfast at the restaurant was better than we had at the JW in Beijing. They ensured they had plenty of options for us since we don't eat pork. The hotel is located adjacent to the Pacific Place Mall which is very upscale but it has an MTR station that you can use to go to Kowloon. You can also walk through the Hong Kong Park (close to the hotel) to get to the Peak Tram stop. We used the Big Bus to tour most of Hong Kong and it was a nice, quick way to see everything and get off and explore places we wanted to. Overall to me this was an average hotel and if I was paying and not staying on points I would look at other options.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: lhreye
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located with direct access to the MRT station. My room was modern and offered splendid views of this wonderful city and Victoria Harbour. The bed was large and comfy, the bathroom ammenities were plentiful and the towels were soft and fluffy. Although i did not get a chance to eat at any of their restaurants, I did manage a drink at the Riedel Room. The staff were polite and warm and added to the charm of this hotel. The hotel is well located on top of a shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Brunch Bliss”
Reviews.Author: Andrew C
Reviews.Content: Benjamin the food and beverages manager is a super star. He made our trip incredible.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel struggling to keep up in Central”
Reviews.Author: IndyGuynside
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the JW Marriott several times over the years mostly on the executive floor. As stated in the previous review, it is a very convenient location in Central with everything you need close, including the MTR subway station, HSBC Bank, Starbucks and Pacific Place, a high end shopping mall. The JW competes with three other hotels in Pacific Place. The most positive point about the JW Mariott is the great staff. Mariott provides two days off for their employees which is evident from their engagement and "can do" attitude towards guests. They are engaged, friendly and always willing to help. Beds are comfortable, bathroom ammenities are excellent, towels are fluffy and the internet service is acceptable. Carpets are worn and the executive lounge - which was refurbished a couple of years ago - is showings its age and is still undersized for the number of people they serve. I feel so bad for the great lounge staff who are forced to work out of a kitchen the size of a closet. Food in the lounge and in the hotel in general is great- rather exceptional in some cases. The property has slowly degraded and needs investment. Standard rooms - even on the executive floor - are very small (even by Hong Kong standards) and suitable for only one guest. This hotel is functional but very busy and not a place you will experience luxury on any scale. It is popular with Americans and you will find large numbers of young families with strollers and kids running around. The gym - located on the lower ground level - is well furnished and very functional with dedicated staff who have been working there for a significant time. Their is no SPA and the mens locker room is small with and suffers from a terrible sewer gas smell with is sometimes so overpowering you must take your shower elsewhere. In the end, the JW Marriott Pacific Place is a 3+ star property which provides a uninspiring predictable stay, but has great staff who make up for its deficiencies. The price paid vs value is questionable. You are paying for the location in Central, not for a luxury stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location and Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: utahfamilytravellers
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic hotel in an amazing location. It sits just s couple blocks from Victoria Harbor and atop the Pacific Place shopping center which is also home to a major MTR stop. The hotel was gorgeous and the staff was top notch. We had a great view of the harbor from our room. The heated hotel was very impressive. Our family really loved our stay in HOng Kong and the JW Marriott was a huge part of that. I have more details about our stay on our blog: www.worldfamilytravellers.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice but the curtains don't block out the light well”
Reviews.Author: phdtravel
Reviews.Content: Good points: Convenient location above Pacific Place shops and restaurants. One notch below the Island Shangri-la and Conrad both in price and luxury. Stayed here for 6 nights. The a/c is efficient. Pleasant smelling toiletries. Service efficient but still feels a bit like a train station at times. Bad points: It's a bit dated but not too bad. Big windows. Upon closing the electronically controlled drapes, the curtains don't cover the windows thoroughly so it gets bright in the morning. Insufficient fabric. A lot of bright lights from clocks and telephones in the room. The bathroom had a foul sewer like smell on the second day. Might be a sewage back up somewhere. The rooms are not that spacious. Beware - a request for a double bedded room isn't a guarantee.

Reviews.Title: “You are paying for the view and location”
Reviews.Author: la310la
Reviews.Content: It is prob. due that we came straight from the Shangri-la in Manila that this hotel didn't WOW us as we would have liked. It is pretty; the staff is well-trained and polite, but it just didn't have much character. I will note that the beds were pretty darn comfortable though! PLUS: - views! at night it is amazing as you are in the heart of the city - MTR and mall. You can walk right into Paclfic Place to shop then head downstairs onto the Admiralty stop and jump the red line if you need to. - Fishbar. They had amazing oysters from FRANCE! MINUS: - rooms are small. The entry way is too narrow! - the plus are in a wooden box and can be awkward if you need to charge batteries or have larger cables. - housekeeping, electrical or whatever staff knocks a lot. I pretty much put my do not disturb for 12 hours straight. - weird glass shower door and small space to bathe

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Judychen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights recently. We chose this hotel because of its proximity to Lippo Center where Taiwanese Consulate is located. We had some paperwork to do and needed to stay close to the consulate office. We stayed in a room with two double beds which was perfect for our family of 2 adults and 2 kids. (Not very many hotels in Hong Kong have rooms with double beds.) The heated swimming pool was great. It allowed the kids to swim even in one of the coldest winter days. (It does get cold in Hong Kong) As for hotel service, it could be improved. On our first night at the hotel as we were getting ready for bed at 9 PM (we had a long day from traveling and other activities), the door bell rang and a hotel maid announced she was there to turn down the beds. Obviously we were not happy to be disturbed. In my opinion, this should have been done by 8:00 and never ever when the guests are resting in the room! On our last day there, the entire family was still asleep at 6:30 AM (very exhausted from our trip to Hong Kong Disney the day before) when the door bell rang again and the hotel staff announced "room service" with a breakfast tray. We were not amused! My husband had to go down to the front desk and sort things out to make sure someone was not playing a joke on us and tried to put their breakfast on our bill. As it turned out, someone in another guest room ordered the room service but wrote down the wrong room number. The manager on duty was very apologetic and offered a beautiful spread of cookies and milk for our children, a basket of baked goodies and coffee for me as well as a late check-out for the family. As our flight home was not until that evening we happily accepted the manager's offer. The manager seemed very sincere and wanted to make sure our stay was good. Because of the late check-out we were able to enjoy our last day in Hong Kong in the comforts of our room (and the pool). The manager turned a not-so-great start of the day into something a lot more pleasant. Over all we were happy with the hotel and will definitely consider staying here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “WoW!!! by far one of the best hotels ive ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: ExpectingtheBest77
Reviews.Content: this hotel was simply beautiful. the lobby, executive lounge and room all had spectacular views. luxury was everywhere. the most important thing though was the service and attention i received from everyone in the hotel. every staff member took extra care to be nice, professional and caring. my room was very comfortable and luxurous. the hotels location was ideal. the executive lounge was top notch. breakfast and afternoon snacks was simply delicious each day. the staff in the executive lounge was stellar. i have traveled the world and stayed at many resorts and hotels, including other marriotts, but this hotel wouldceasily be included in my top 5 hotels worldwide. highly, highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for business visits and on a par with the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: IanandPaula
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to the JWM and I wasn't disappointed. I visit HK at least monthly and normally stay in the Conrad which is next door but this time couldn't get a room and the JWM came to the rescue. Same great location with good access to the business district. Compared to the Conrad the rooms aren't quite as nice (but still very good with nothing to complain about) but the choice of bar and restaurant facilities are well ahead. A really nice bar with evening entertainment and a number of good dining choices. Breakfast was good with both hot and continental buffets available. Pricewise it was in line with the usual cost of a major city centre hotel, so not cheap, but you get what you pay for. All in all, a good choice and I am now torn between my tried and tested favourite the Conrad, and the JWM. Tough one!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, nice views, bed was a little hard.”
Reviews.Author: pekopper
Reviews.Content: Excellant view of the water front, looking towards Kowloon. Very nice room, nice bath with huge towels. Food was excellant, best in Hong Kong that I've tasted on my 20+ years of going there. Drive from th airport is a little further than the Kowloon hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but dated hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJX
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is excellent. In the business district, beside an enormous mall and above the subway station. Service is excellent as well. But the rooms are quite dated, it needs a revamp to be truly top class.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel... business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: SSS2005
Reviews.Content: Really like this hotel. 2nd visit there and it is very good for business and for pleasure. Far East service at its best. Very nice rooms, excellent food and well priced. Don' t think I would conisder another hotel when in HK...

Reviews.Title: “Are all rooms corner rooms?”
Reviews.Author: Jetlager
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in (the trip was booked using points) we were told that we were upgraded to a corner room. The room is fantastic - it has a view of the harbor, a nice, clean bathroom and great amenities. It is much larger than rooms we've had in comparable cities. Everything here has been top-notch. From the minute we were greeted through every day we've been recognized, doors have been opened, food has been great, coffee has been free, and service has been impeccable. On top of that, we're staying above the Pacific Place mall which has an MTR station and the Great Food Hall which is an expats dream of grocery stores. When the hotel couldn't book a pedicure for me, they scheduled me at a great place in the mall, walked me there, and got me a discount. On top of everything else, they provide a few free bottles of water each day and a lovely fruit plate that they keep refilling. Additionally, the waiter at breakfast (who was wonderful) gave us an amazing tip on a local lunch place when he figured out our daughter only eats noodles (lunch for 4 under $15 and fantastic). Usually, when you're on points you feel like a second class citizen but that has not been the case at all. As far as the title, my son noticed that the architecture of the hotel from the outside appears that there are many corners. Maybe all rooms are corner rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but a little overpriced”
Reviews.Author: 0_Cabin_Fever4
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the JW Marriott in HK a couple of times, and always found it very comfortable, but recently, even by HK standards, I think they are starting to price themselves out of the market. Over the past couple of years, HK hotel rates have increased substantially, yet the Marriott seems to have gone beyond other similar properties in the area. Saying that, I stayed for 3 nights recently as i was attending a conference in Kowloon, and the service and quality was excellent. Check-in was very smooth, free internet, room service was great with a good selection, and the gym is fairly well appointed. Well located above Pacific Place shopping centre, next to Admiralty MRT, one stop from Central. I will stay again but only if their rates are a little more competitive. Also note that the last time I stayed here, they put me in a room adjacent to the service room, and the staff were opening and closing the door all night, continual banging. This time I specifically asked not to be put near this room and didn't have a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: aviIndia
Reviews.Content: This hotel has staff who are very attentive to their guest’s needs to make your stay very comfortable. Check-in & Check-out are very fast and efficient. The room-size is average and it feels like a totally business hotel. They still use metal keys for entry into room. Not all rooms have good views of the harbour. It is well-located and well connected to the Airport Express station(5 mins by cab). One of the upmarket mall of HK(Pacific Mall) is located in the basement of this hotel.That makes it convenient for shoppers.

Reviews.Title: “Of the four hotels in this cluster above Pacific Place the Marriott is my least favourite”
Reviews.Author: Anglotraveller
Reviews.Content: The lobby is small and unfriendly although there were always lots of staff on hand to keep things moving along (more like policemen rather than hotel staff). The check-in was like going through immigration at a US airport! Rooms and enough but old fashioned and getting a little tired. Overall I found it expensive for what was on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: gandarien
Reviews.Content: At a pretty nice and quiet location, and self-sufficient as it's attached to the Pacific Place mall and a stop away from the hustle and bustle of Central and Causeway Bay. There're also a couple of good jogging routes around the hotel and the room is perfectly set-up for work. Am rating it 4/5 for the fact that room cleaning is not impeccable - the ice bucket contained remmants of the melted water from the previous occupant, and remained so throughout my three days stay. Likewise, the main plug wasn't checked, so the desk extension didn't work and it took 15 mins of stooping around to troubleshoot and fixed the plug.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience.....”
Reviews.Author: pnmehta
Reviews.Content: This lovely property by Marriott is in the heart of Hong Kong's shopping and commercial center. The hotel is connected to the Pacific Place Shopping mall which can be accessed from its basement. The rooms are reasonably spacious and the location of the hotel makes it perfect for eating out, shopping or even a business trip. No doubt there are better and more luxurious hotels in the area but this hotel has a busy bustling lobby and having gone at Christmas time the festive spirit was very evident. The bar called Q88 has a superb collection of wines and the live jazz singers make it a truly lively and entertaining place. The hotel rises high and therefore views from the upper floors is truly breathtaking. Our stay was very pleasant and the staff was attentive, polite and ensured that my family and i had a memorable experience. I have stayed there twice and would do so again if i went to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “First time staying on Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: kwoong
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with good connections to everywhere, with just the subway station connecting at the basement. Generous and Good food and drinks at the Club lounge. Rooms is pacious enough by Hong Kong standard.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel, terrific service”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiNut02760
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for several days at the beginning of November 2011. Upon arrival, staff is very attentive to ensuring check in is fast and efficient. Bags are whisked up to your room right after you finish checking in. Hotel has a very good fitness room as well as a really nice outdoor pool and hot tub. Staff at the pool provide towels as well as water to guests, which is a nice touch. Ate at the JW Cafe which was pretty good and decently priced for a hotel restaurant. As a Gold Marriott Member, I used the Executive Lounge quite a bit. They had great choices of food for breakfast and offered a number of nice appetizers at dinner hour. The view from the Executive Club is fantastic. I really enjoy staying at this hotel for the fabulous service and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & very good service”
Reviews.Author: RoxanneUS
Reviews.Content: Spent a week on business in HK. Great staff and the concierge was really helpful booking everything for us. The Pacific Place Mall is right under the hotel! How convenient is that! There are some good restaurants around, the breakfast buffet is really nice. Higher rooms have an awesome view - all rooms have 2 walls completely made out of glass from floor to ceiling, although are pretty small - but i guess this is how HK is...not a lot of space available. Really enjoyed my stay!

Reviews.Title: “great location, good service and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: weechuan
Reviews.Content: been here since sunday.easy access to admiralty mtr via pacific place shopping (an upmarket mall with the top brands). the executive lounge service is professional and well provided for. health centre is well equipped and kept to the highest standards. Bad: the pool is tiny, the food at the fish bar is not spectacular and overpriced. the staff are bent on closing exactly at 2230h and the pool locked off by 2300h. probably paid by the minute or have families to dash back to. wine is served in ridiculous looking plastic tumbles if you sit outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, First Rate, Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: 822mn
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at hotel, stayed on 34th floor, executive level, nice room, two walls of glass windows, amazing views. Executive floors breakfast and afternoon bar/snacks were great. Attached to very high end mall, if you need a place to eat, the mall has grocery store on lower level that has everything, I think called Great Eat/Hall. Lots of market shopping and restaurants only a few blocks straight east from the hotel. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business and good transportation”
Reviews.Author: J G
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd time at this Hotel as , always Marriott does a great job and is very efficient and confortable... Club Level is very helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: sss1970t
Reviews.Content: What a hotel ! All polished and shiny... clean, cool and fresh smelling - all important factors in Hong Kong. We stayed for 2 nights at the JWM in interconnecting rooms, which they ensured were available for us, given that we were travelling with children and seniors. Booked the hotel in the name of my father in law, who is a senior citizen, and the Marriott allows you to book 2 rooms in the name of a senior citizen. This, I thought was very considerate and also very fair. The mall - Pacific Place - was great, but is mostly high end international shopping. So if you want the Hong Kong market stores, this is certainly not the place. There is a really good cafe in the basement, next to the supermarket that serves breakfast all day too. The rooms are large, clean, great beds, and decent view. Overall ambiance is that of a good 5 star luxury hotel. Enjoyed the live music in the lobby bar one evening. The concierge was helpful with the city tour reservations, as well as our reservations at restaurants on both evenings. We got a chance to see the Halloween celebrations up close on that Saturday as a result of his reccommendation. The best part of the stay was the fantastic breakfast..... varied - from dim sum to waffles and 6 types of fresh fruits. All very fresh. Well located, and just 10 mins taxi ride from most places. Overall a great stay - lives upto the JWM tag. Slightly expensive compared to other hotels, but this is Hong Kong !

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ann C
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott Hong Kong is a terrific hotel, from the wonderful staff to the great views. The executive lounge has excellent food, the concierge staff is very helpful and cheerful, and our room was very comfortable. What is really great, though, is the location! The hotel is above an upscale mall (check out the clever Harvey Nichols window displays) and an MRT station. MRT in HK is very easy to manoever! Not far from the hotel by foot is the wonderful Hong Kong Park, and the Victoria Peak tram station is just a bit further.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff saved a possible disaster”
Reviews.Author: Sue-and-Steve-Ascot
Reviews.Content: Chose the J W under a rewards scheme and at check-in there was confusion about the arrangements and we faced a big bill. But Grace, the front desk supervisor made the problems go away as soon as she got involved! Thanks Grace. The hotel is a good base for exploring HK and Kowloon as it is next to an MTR station and close to many of the sights. The facilities are really good, including the pool area and the breakfast buffet is enormous and top quality. The hotel is also above the Pacific Place mall with lots of high- end shops but also a Great (that is it's name) Supermarket for anything you might need. The staff generally are excellent , very friendly and full of ideas, suggestions and assistance. The normal rates are not cheap - but then Hong Kong isn't a cheap a destination!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, love this place”
Reviews.Author: camelot77
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is really fab. Right next to Pacific Place, one of the largest malls in Hong Kong with plenty of dining options, just that most of the shopping is pretty expensive. The hotel is also connected to the MTR station, just a 5 mins walk. The rooms were very clean and very thoughfully laid out with a good selection of toiletries and fresh fruits every day. The service here was excellent as well and the staff are very attentive. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stopover stay!”
Reviews.Author: cruisernut
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night before flight home using award points. Room had a fantastic 180 degree view of the harbor with very comfy beds (I prefer harder beds). Very convenient location immediately above admiralty MTR stop which allowed us to maximize the day and a half we had in Hong Kong. Some of the most friendly, efficient, and helpful staff I have ever encountered! Front desk, concierge, bell boys all made it a smooth experience. Note that the mall is more high end so for food options would go elsewhere to get more local eats. I would definitely stay here again on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Rocks....”
Reviews.Author: Cweetd
Reviews.Content: New year's party at JW Marriott was amazing... I really enjoyed the party... The band was awesome... Anyways the hotel is a very cool place to stay, it's very convenient n easy to locate, as it's next to a MTR Station...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Travellerandco
Reviews.Content: Service is really exemplary at this hotel. Very good top to bottom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all-around place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wulanhandr
Reviews.Content: Impeccable service, excellent location (MRT and shopping center underneath). Stayed here twice already, never dissapointed, always coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary hotel with extraordinary views”
Reviews.Author: tnc2u
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel--one of the best stays I have ever had. We were on the Executive level, and the views are amazing. The staff persons are very professional and go out of their way.

Reviews.Title: “Concentrated luxury, great service”
Reviews.Author: Welltravelledlady
Reviews.Content: As previous reviewers have said, the rooms are small, especially felt as we had our 2 small children sharing it with us! We stayed on the executive floor, and utilised the club to the fullest, as we were jet-lagged and also my husband was sick so we ended up eating there as often as we could rather than leaving the hotel. The beds were very comfortable and we slept well. There was one day we didn't get the room made up and security actually called us up to check we were ok! The staff were 100% professional and extremely helpful. We chose here as we wanted to put 4 in a room and the Marriot was the best positioned on HK Island as we prefer there to Kowloon. Our room had a harbour view although a lot of it was still blocked but we still had amazing views of the fireworks display for the PRC birthdaty on Oct 1st and we couldn't believe our luck as it was all unplanned! There is a large rooftop pool and spa which the children will love, weather permitting!

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anon Y
Reviews.Content: This hotel would be a five star hotel in the States. The service is above and beyond, the food is delicious, and the room was clean and inviting. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money you pay for”
Reviews.Author: busymomMD
Reviews.Content: A truly 5star experience. The lobby is spacious and inviting. Though the rooms are average in size, the common areas are spacious and classy. The location is excellent because right below is the Pacific Place mall which you can reach easily as it is connected to the hotel. The MTR station is also right below. taxis are easy to get and the staff are very helpful in getting you one. The breakfast and high tea at the coffee shop is also great with a variety of food items you can choose from. there is surely something for evryone evn picky eaters. they even provide paper bags in the bread section if you wish to bring up a muffin or bread to your room!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: 23angeles
Reviews.Content: Went to Hong Kong for a meeting and so I had to spend the night somewhere. Luckily my client booked me in this Hotel. Took the airport express into the City and the Hotel was just less than 10 mins (HK$20) from the station. Check in was easy and lady who brought me to my room took the time to explain everything, including the phone system, to me. FREE INTERNET ACCESS!! The room I was in, # 3423, was a small room. It was good that it had a king size bed but it was because of it that the room felt cramped to me. Bathroom was small as well but with complete amenities. Shaving kit, toothbrush, comb, cotton buds, hair dryer, separate shower and tub, magnifying mirror, etc. All marble and glass with great lighting (excellent for shaving). 2 bathrobes were provided. As well as SIX large fluffy towels Room had a personal safe, ironing facilities, well-stocked with coffee and tea, and there was always 2 complimentary water bottles. There was also an umbrella that you could use in case it was raining outside. The room had a 42" plasma tv with a remote audio/video connection panel for your video camera or computer located at the side of the room's desk. You can then, if you were inclined, make the plasma tv your computer monitor. The plasma tv was also mounted on a bracket that allowed you to swing out the screen and even tilt it. One thing I found interesting was that you could hear whatever was playing on the tv in the speaker mounted on the bathroom's ceiling. This way, if you were watching something like CNN, you could continue to listen to it while i the bathroom. I had a room on the was on the executive floor so I had access to the executive lounge. There would be something to eat the whole day (not much selections but enough) and free wine (good quality) at night. The executive lounge had a good view of HK Harbour but since it was a rainy night, couldn't see much of it. The service was excellent! This Hotel is on top of the Pacific Place Mall but I didn't have time to see it, so I can't say anything about it :-(.

Reviews.Title: “Hardest beds!”
Reviews.Author: JOP1_10
Reviews.Content: Let me come clean at the outset. The Mandarin Oriental and The Four Seasons are my favorite hotels in Central ( I never stay on Kowloon side). And staying at a kittle slice of America isn't my idea of nirvana either ( don't get me wrong, I love visiting America). That said I have stayed here at least twice before I think as it is one of my firms corporate hotels. The service as you'd expect in HK is very nice - attentive and professional. But the hotel is somewhat dated. I changed rooms because the plumbing in my bathroom shook every time rooms around me used their bathroom facilities. The staff were lovely and apologetic when they moved me and again when I checked out. My main disappointment was how hard the beds were. I stayed four nights, woke up every two hours and have a sore back now. After the second night I asked for a feather bed to be added to the bed. It was promptly added but did not make the bed noticeably more comfortable. Room service was ok but not fabulous. I at Fish one night, again was OK but I wouldn't rush back. The Riedel wine bar has a nice selection of wine and had a band playing when I was there on a Monday night. If I wasn't staying there because I had colleagues there, it would not be my choice in HK. Wi- fi was included in the room rate. Thank you Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation service leaves much to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Becky N
Reviews.Content: Booked a family package for December 2011 for 2 adults and 2 very young children. Requested for 2 double beds (non-smoking) and a baby cot for the baby. Hotel's reply is no guarantee for any of these requested. In their last email, they said baby cot is on first come first served basis. And that is after all modes of contact - international toll free line, direct phone call to Marriott Hong Kong, online chat with live assistant and emails. No guarantee and first come first served?? From a hotel that's touted one of the best in the world? What is reservation for then? A reservation made well in advance and it was for a family package offered. No other reputable hotel does that. So it could be a situation where our five month old infant has no cot, and we have only a king size bed for all four of us (2 adults, a four year old and a five month old infant)?? Leaves one wondering if the hotel is sincere in selling this family package or their approach to turn away families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pankaj077
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable stay. The best thing I liked about the hotel was the proximity to the CBD. Food quality left a little to be desired but other than that the amenties were excellent, the staff was very courteous and the rooms offered a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Twosome”
Reviews.Author: prasadkls20
Reviews.Content: I have stayed along with my family and office colleagues. Stayed around 2 months in HK. It is very adjacent to the Lockhard Street (which is the most happening place). All the main pubs are present over the same place. Unlimited enjoyment throughout the day. The rooms and service at JW Marriott is excellent. Based on the stay period the good negotiations would work out cheaper. The rates are very flexible when compared to other hotels around the city. This is most advantageous aspect of JW at Pacific place, HK. Definitely one can give a try and enjoy the most of the services. All type of services from Jacuzzi, sauna, Steam Bath, Massages are very cheap when compared to the HK standards. Big Lounges and additional services are also offered based on the special requirements. Try and Taste the un believable experience

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: BEECheltenham
Reviews.Content: A Great hotel with all conveniences, reasonably priced, for Position and what you get. Great Fish Restaurant, unfortunately did not have Barramundi on 2nd visit but were able to offer something equally as good. Pool was good and below hotel, a Magnificent Designer Shopping Mall (which also stretched under the Conrad and Shangri-La) - which had everything in it except £8,500 for a hand-bag is way beyond our reach! Bring plenty of money, this Mall is like 15 First Class Airports run together, without the crush.

Reviews.Title: “great service JW Marriot Hongkong”
Reviews.Author: LeoB188590
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife for a few weeks in JW Marriott in Hongkong. We were very satisfied with the service. everybody was so kind and helpfull, especially the team in the Executive Lounge were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location / View but Rooms look tired”
Reviews.Author: Ray A
Reviews.Content: Ideally loacated with shopping areas around and a good view from the room but the rooms looked very tired. They really need to re-do their rooms. Lobby is nice and lively but given a choice I would I would not prefer to stay here again with other better options around.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: suny5
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favourite Marriott's, I just wish I could stay here more often. Location is excellent, adjacent to Pacific Place and above Admiralty MTR stop. Mall has a nice range of shops from a supermarket to high end goods. Room was compact but well appointed. Floor to ceiling windows looking out on the harbour, nice touches such as electronic blinds. Exec lounge is one of my favourite - nice breakfast and evening snacks and a few times i've been in the hotel in the afternoon scones and tea were available. Some evenings a cocktail of the day was available and in the evenings it has a nice view of the harbour lights. Gym in the basement, no view but enough equipment to get a good workout. While on the pricey side, I always choose this hotel in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Checks every box”
Reviews.Author: thequeeeen
Reviews.Content: This hotel checks every box in terms of what you'd expect from a hotel, you'd wish you could stay here permanently. Great rooms, service, amenities, location, view, there's hardly anything more you could ask for.

Reviews.Title: “This is the area you want to be.”
Reviews.Author: Smittyucla3
Reviews.Content: Everything is what you expect in a Marriot. The staff is great, the rooms are clean with everything you need, a big restaurant and lounge. The location is right where you need to be. Walking distance from the train or just a few minutes in a taxi to wherever you need to be on Hong Kong island. The only issues is that for the money probably could find a better deal somewhere but you can always count on the Marriot to have a nice clean room with a friendly, knowledgable staff.

Reviews.Title: “Georgeous hotel with very high standards of service”
Reviews.Author: JohnelnWeldon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip in May and on first impressions the hotel is spectacular! Everything about this hotel exudes quality. The room and bathroom were to a very high standard and very well equipped. There was lots of bars and restaurants in the hotel to meet most tastes. The hotel is in a really good location - close to the main business district and not far from main railway station. I just cannot fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like a king, fabulous access to the MTR”
Reviews.Author: TravelEatRepeat
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel can't be beat. It's right on top of the Admiralty MTR station, with direct access through Pacific Plaza. For that alone this was a great place to stay. The staff is very attentive and accommodating. The room wasn't huge but it had floor to ceiling panorama windows with a great view. The bed isn't the most luxuriously comfortable, but slept fine. Breakfast in the executive lounge was excellent and free because of our Marriott Rewards status. The pool is small but beautiful with a great view of the city. Worst pina colada I ever had from Fish Bar. room rate is steep though, so everything should be great. Free Airport express shuttle stops here if you're coming from the airport by train.

Reviews.Title: “Familiar Marriott standards plus excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Visitors4
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Our room had a great views of the city as well as Victoria Peak. The room was smaller than other hotels (Shangri-la and Westin) we stayed in during our 2 week tour of China, but was still comfortable with enough storage. The bathroom was comfortably large with a great shower and large sunken tub. We had access to the concierge level services, and the food/beverage quality, selection and service were very good. The pool area was large for a city hotel, clean and nice atmosphere for relaxing. The pool also had staff who attended to guests as needed. The hotel staff is excellent and helpful. Definitely would stay at this hotel again. The location of the hotel is great and convenient to transportation to all parts of Hong Kong and Kowloon. You don't even have to walk outside to get to the MTA. The MTA is so fast, convenient, and the stations are air-conditioned. From the airport, the Airport Express is the most convenient way to get into the city. In less than half hour, you'll be in the Central area of Hong Kong - the train is clean, comfortable, and fast. Free shuttle buses are available to take you to select hotels. Restaurants - Peking Garden in Kowloon, Jade Garden in Causeway Bay - great food. Lei Garden in Elements Mall (great dim sum). Local tip - make reservations for restaurants, including dim sum. Visit the 360 degree Cable Car in Lantau - if you go on the weekend, suggest going in the mid-afternoon where there are less lines. Or buy tickets advance on-line. Fabulous views of Hong Kong and the Big Buddha. Temple Market is also a great street market shopping experience - go at night. We had a great time in Hong Kong - exciting diverse city, and the JW Marriott was a great place to rest and relax each day.

Reviews.Title: “Top class service”
Reviews.Author: ozallan
Reviews.Content: The JW is in a great location in Hong Kong, on top of a world class shopping centre with also a large array of restaurants as well as a subway station below the property - location, location, location. But the thing that stands out is the service. There are a large number of staff but they are not obtrusive or over the top. But all are helpful and friendly, nothing is too much trouble. I have been to Hong Kong many times and have stayed at a variety of good 5 star hotels but the service I experienced here was second to done and will be the main reason I would return. The other reason I would return is the buffet breakfast. It is outstanding from the personally prepared smoothies, the soft tasty scrambled eggs, the variety of many other items including ice cream!! Just loved the spread. The rooms are a good size, not huge but comfortable with all the necessary mod cons including a huge flat screen TV. In summary a great place to stay in Hong & Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Level is fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: juliet k
Reviews.Content: I traveled alone to Hong Kong from San Francisco with 3 children at the beginning of a 2 week China trip. We had the car from the hotel pick us up which began a fabulous stay at the JW Marriott. When we arrived Andy met us and escorted us directly to our room, by passing the whole check in counter wait. I booked a suite with concierge level access which was perfect. The suite was very corporate but comfortable. We had an unexpectedly lovely view of the harbor from the 25th floor. The suite only had one queen bed but they quickly brought up 2 rollaways. My kids loved the outdoor pool which was a treat after touring around hot and humid Hong Kong. The concierge level was a delight. Breakfast, tea and the evening offering (including free alcohol) was a lifesaver. The breakfast was complete with hot entrees (both western and Asian), fruit, veggies, a cappuchino maker and a lovely view of the harbor. I would highly recommend staying at the JW Marriott as the service and amenities were perfect. The manager even stopped by and gave us some good ideas about what and when to visit certain attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms & fitness centre, staff were all very good”
Reviews.Author: dumu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and was thoroughly impressed with the room, the large TV in the room, the ability to control all the lights (and the curtains) from bedside, and the delivery of fresh fruit every day. The fitness centre was excellent and also had fresh fruit available. The hotel is connected to a mall and we found a good "deli" style restaurant on the ground floor that served a good breakfast. My wife came with me on the trip and she really enjoyed sitting by the outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Stay”
Reviews.Author: klh717
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms with my teenage children for 4 nights, check in was quick and smooth and glad that they gave us 2 adjoining rooms with one king & 1 twin beded room at the corner on a high floor facing hill view. Twin beded room with 4' heavenly bed which is lovely and comfortable. Location is just perfect with all mode of transport ie: MTR is directly below the hotel, tram is on the street, bus to Ocenan Park is adjacent to hotel building. Tim Sam in the hotel is marvellous and the must try buffet lunch. Shopping mall is also adjacent to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints whatsoever. Just go there.”
Reviews.Author: tat1500
Reviews.Content: We seriously have no complaints. I've had to ask the whole family to sit down and think and they can't find any faults with the hotel. Really great location. Really great service. Really great rooms with a view! Really great everything. I wished we'd stayed there longer. It made our trip in Hong Kong pretty amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Top- rated, can't find fault”
Reviews.Author: vivi003
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel almost midnight, the conceirge overheard what the taxi driver tried to charge us, and told us it should be $50 or so lower, good first impression. What I like most about the hotel - free Wifi at the lobby! While using my IPhone to download mails, I found out at certain part of the hotel, the wifi connection didn't go away. For the 4 nights we stayed, I got wifi in the room every night. If the connection lost, we will go to the lobby again and whoola, its back to the room, despite being at the 18th floor. Another bonus, free coffee and tea at the lobby for those on the go in the morning. Its good coffee /expresso machine and many types of tea bags to choose if you have to forgo breakfasts or rush for meetings, this is what I called REAL service. Breakfast was good too, many types of dried fruits, very fresh nuts to go with the cereal; lots of fresh fruits too; not to mential the usual variety of hot food and egg corners etc. Additional surprise was when the waitress brought along and serving each table the famous HK "milked tea" and toffee-top custard bun " por lo pau"; a typical HK breakfast item in most street outlets. Room was great, every detail taken care of, desk full of every business need even the rubber bands, small stapler. Not a big deal but you will feel like well looked after. The layout of the room did not make it feel crowded even though the built up is average size. Lots of gadgets at the bedside to play with to control the blinds, lighting automatically. Definitely my choice of hotel at Pacific Place

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but smallish rooms”
Reviews.Author: LizaNTrevor
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location with a shopping mall and train station just under neath it. It was very convenient for us to get in and out and around Hong Kong from there. The only down side is the size of the hotel room. for 3 adults and a toddler - the room was pretty small. The views of the harbour were great though. Go for a corner room if you can. The breakfast room and the variety of food on offer is certainly worth the money. Great spread of western and asian dishes. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and welcoming. They arranged our taxi to the airport and ensured that we weren't ripped off. As it's a Marriott you can count on the extremely good quality bed and pillow. We'd certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Hong Kong for Western Travelers”
Reviews.Author: mrittmayer
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything when you are on the club floor 33 & 34. Food and drinks all day lovely pool, close to everything staff that are quite attentive to every wish. Fresh grapefruit juice all day long. If you come to Hong Kong and stay here on a weekend....you can hit every place on the island by taxi from this central spot and enjoy a 1st class experience in a safe sound room and a great sleep. Attached to a great mall with a great food store and shopping plus MTR....you win on every front ! even underground walkway to pacific place 3 and the Wan Chai district....OOH LA LA

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with high standard”
Reviews.Author: chocodung
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a corner room with harbour and a bit of mountain view, a large LED TV with many international TV channels, large working desk and comfortable bed. Hotel staff are very professional. Basement is a big shopping mall and connected to MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “Continues to be a family FAVORITE!!”
Reviews.Author: Mis_Adventurous
Reviews.Content: This hotel continues to impress!! We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and were pleased to find a treat of chocolate strawberries and champagne from the staff. In addition, my husband had asked the concierge to arrange for some beautiful roses to be in the room in certain colors (and they were . . . and they lasted all week). We enjoyed the fresh fruit left in the room each day and the water. I would also be remiss if I didn't mention the help we received from Anna Lee in guest relations. Our son had an accident earlier in our trip to China and began running a fever. Anna accompanied us to a local clinic and sat with us through the entire appointment! On our departure date, we had the hotel driving service deliver us to the airport for another hotel colleague was waiting to take our bags to the check-in counter. This hotel is outstanding and we will continue to stay here during our trips to HK! Oh, and the sushi in their restaurant was HEAVENLY!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect example of the ultimate hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: darrenj
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the JW for 5 nights recently whilst on business, I've stayed in a lot of hotels over the years and the Marriott chain has never stood out, until now. We booked a car via the hotel from the airport which delivered us in style, the hotel even phoned en-route to ask if there was anything I needed. Checkin was slick, bags delivered to the room swiftly and the room was great with a great bed and nice view. Breakfast was excellent each day, huge choice (try the watermelon juice) and the service was superb from every member of staff I came across. I was fortunate to travel with someone who had access to the exec lounge which had great views of the harbor on the top floor, afternoon tea with scones and cream are not to be missed! A superb stay, can't wait to try another JW to see if this is typical of the JW experience.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: williamw2011
Reviews.Content: As soon as I arrived at the hotel (after a long flight) I was upsold to a more expensive room, under the pretext of including breakfast. It was 2 days later I realised this had happened to me, at a cost of 100 pounds more per day, and after complaining i was moved to a different room. Because i had complained, the service began to deteriorate. It got to the point where i felt there was a geniune animosity toward me from the hotel staff, particularly on reception. and I was glad and releived to exit the hotel after a week. For sure I will never patronise a Marriott hotel again. I am sure that many people have had a pleasant experience at the JW marriott HK, but for me it was a nightmare that I could not wait to end.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel - great location and fantastic rooms”
Reviews.Author: IainandGavin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a joy to stay in. Room and bathroom amazing - great diagonal windows and everything electronically controllable from the bedside. Lots of lovely subtle touches. Nothing too much trouble for the staff. The Exec Lounge was great and breakfasts there high quality. Felt very peaceful there. Recommend the outdoor pool in the evening - I had it to myself. All in all, this is where I would elect to stay when I am next due to go to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: MWang
Reviews.Content: Don't let the hotel snobs tell you that Marriots are aaverage. In Hong Kong at this location, it is the best value and best location. It is connected to the Pacific Place shopping Mall which has all the best stores in the world, that is then connected to another local mall with wonderful local goods and boutiques. YOu can walk through all the indoor malls and end up in downtown Hong Kong near the maandarin Hotel and now you are smack in the middle of everything. Traffic is always so congested in HK that if you can walk to most of your destinations, you are saving time and money. The hotel is beautifully decorated and the rooms are clean, modern and comfortable with a bathroom that puts the overpriced European deluxe hotels to shame. Their lobby restaurant has the best buffet dinner in town, HK loves buffets and everyone tries to outdo each other. The Chinese restaurant down in the lower level is also very good. Rooms run under 300.00 a night and if you belong to the Marriot club you get a further discount plus earn points. Dont forget to take the train fronm the airport into town and NOT the taxi, buy a roundtrip ticket and save more. The train takes you into downtown HK and they have free buses that drop you off at different hotels. This is far cheaper than a traffic congested taxi ride and the train is very comfortable and clean. Check when you buy the ticket at the airport terminal which hotels have free drop off. When you leave HK, just take a cab to the train terminal again, and do your airport check in right there at the terminal. Most airlines have a stand there for your convenience. This way, you only have to take your hand carry onto the train and next stop airport and straight to immigration.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter11111
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night passing thru HK with my daughter. Hotel is very good . Easy access from hong kong airport train station by H1 shuttle bus. Possibly more a business hotel due to its location. Safe choice and you will sleep well and enjoy your day. The pool is not as large as the photos indicate but still good. Staff are extermely helpful and this is a great attribute to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BellaMorganHill
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed her for 2 nights and loved it. The staff could not be more attentive! We had a corner room with a view to-die-for! The location was excellent. I recommend walking from the hotel thru Hong Kong Park and take the tram up to Victoria Peak. Our other favorite excursion was to the Big Buddha on Lantau island.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: silkroadworker
Reviews.Content: Good quality environment and facilties. Executive staff are excellent...restaurant and room staff sometimes brusque and cold even when you are friendly with them, which lets the place down a little. But overall, it's a good option in the price range when staying in central.

Reviews.Title: “Service was exquisite!!!”
Reviews.Author: lizziebarf
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for seven nights in June 2011. My friend had questions, so she called the hotel directly- the staff said that an employee who could help her would call back. He did, long distance and chatted for over 30 minutes with my friend. Alvin, the wonderful desk clerk, even upgraded our room to one facing the harbor on a high floor when he heard it was my first visit. This turned out to be of great value, as we both caught a cold on the plane ride over and spent more time in the room than planned! The room was a corner room, with tall windows that let us watch the harbor and the light show from the neighboring skyscrapers! I spent a lot of time gazing out those windows! Joshua, the clerk that checked us in went up to the room with our bellman and showed us around. He then sent up welcoming tea and fruit, which was lovely! Our fruit and bottled water was replenished daily, and when we fell ill, the housekeepers gave us more water whenever needed. Room service was excellent, and came in about 20 minutes every time we ordered it. Housekeeping respected the "Do not disturb" light, and came very quickly when we pressed the "service" button. We enjoyed the Marriott Cafe daily, and the Fish Bar by the pool had a nice happy hour. JW's Steakhouse was good as well. The only restaurant we did not try was the Chinese one on site. All in all, the Marriott is a lovely hotel with outstanding service. Everyone from the bellhop to the concierge was wonderful! I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody willing to pay the money... Hong Kong is very expensive!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel- love the coffee!!”
Reviews.Author: shadab31
Reviews.Content: On my second trip to HK i decided to try the marriot again as my first stay last year was a good one there. Love the central location and lovely gym. Enjoyed everybit of my stay day and love the wonderful pool !! absolute value for money

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Amits
Reviews.Content: Went there with the wife and two very young children (3 and 1) in May for 4 nights. We had an excellent stay at this hotel. The rooms are amazing - large and comfortable. The hotel is designed such that each room gives a feel of being a corner room - every room has two large windows. Our room over saw the hills and the conrad hotel with th epool below. There would be nothing else that I could have asked for in the room. The twin beds were large enough for each of us to sleep with one baby comfortably. The bathroom was large and had a shower quibical and a tub. The breakfast restaurant was the only one we ever visited given the young children. It spread is one of the largest I have seen and of excellent quality. They even have haggen daz ice cream which my kids froke out on. The service at this restaurant (and accross the hotel) is outstanding. The chef who cooks the eggs to order kept an eye out on most guests and was very helpful. He made us make sandwitches from the breakfast buffet to take away along with muffins and fruits etc so that we dint struggle with the kids for food at disney or ocean park or other places we went to during the day. We ordered room service every day and thought it was very good. Limited vegitarian options but they are willing to try and do things off menu. The location is nice and quite close to most places. Walk to the peak. Once station change to disney by train (or 100 HKD and 30 min cab ride). It has a popular mall under it (pacific) and is a 5 min cab ride away from IFC the most popular mall in HK. Highly recommended to all especially if your traveling with kids. Forgot to mention that they hand out small teddy bears to kids when they see them. My kids were begining to have a personal collection in all colours till we had to politely say we already have so many of them.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but otherwise nothing special”
Reviews.Author: jamesjustin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights for a quick end of the year getaway. I choose it mainly for the location near Central and connection to the Pacific Place shopping mall (I was also there to shop). The location was indeed good with easy access to the shops as well as the subway station. I had a standard room on the executive level with a king size bed. It was clean, average size, nice furnishings. All-in-all nothing bad about it at all but then again nothing particularly noteworthy. Definitely geared towards being a basic but very nice business hotel. The exec lounge offered a decent selection of food and snacks but was very crowded in the mornings making it difficult at times to get a seat and certainly not a place (at least in the morning) where I would feel comfortable relaxing or taking my time given how busy it was. Overall, the JW Marriott is a solid choice if the location is near where you want to be and you can get a decent rate. Otherwise you might as well check out other options in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scotswaehae
Reviews.Content: I stayed on business for 3 nights. I had a fabulous corner room on the 24th floor. The staff were very helpful and always keen to check that everything was fine for me. The buffet restaurant was really good for breakfast and I had one evening meal there too. Food is very reasonable with wine about the same price as Uk. Room service was good. The hotel is big and busy and I did not have time to use any other facilities in the hotel. I had free wifi as I have a Marriott Rewards card and this was a great benefit. Taxis are just outside the hotel and are cheap. The train system is also just underneath the hotel and is very efficient, cheap and easy to use. There is the Pacific Place mall just beside the hotel with many global shops therefore more expensive than the market I visited for cheap handbags and sunglasses! I also went up The Peak cable car before I headed to the airport on the train. It is great that I could check my bags in at the train station and therefore did not have to manage my suitcase on the train. If I return on business or holiday, I would stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel in the centre of HK”
Reviews.Author: Biggin
Reviews.Content: I stopped at this hotel for a week on business in July 2010. The hotel is conveniently located for Hong Long Island, and if you like shopping, just above the Pacific Place shopping mall. The room I had was on the 9th floor, which had a reasonable view of the harbour. At the weekend I was lucky enough to be able to spend some time around the pool, which was lovely, and perfectly clean! Room service was quick and fairly reasonable, considering general prices in HK compared to the GBP. I also used the laundry service and found this to be good.

Reviews.Title: “A BEAUTIFUL JW MARRIOTT.”
Reviews.Author: calie06
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe king room harbor view. the room is very nice, clean, with a beautiful view , a little small. As Marriott gold elite member, we also could enjoyed the executive lounge which was perfect, food was very good , lot of choices for breakfasts ( western and eastern styles), lunches and appetizers. Staff there was very kind, and help us a lot to plan our visits of Hong Kong. The location is excellent, next to an upscale shopping mall, and a direct access to the subway. We had a diner at the JW's California, very good restaurant, it was the " french" month, and as a french myself I enjoyed it a lot ! The swimming pool is very enjoyable after a warm and humid day.. Overall, the service was perfect, and had a great memories of this stay, If we come back to Hong Kong we'll stay again here for sure !!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing not thought of, Amazing service and absolute luxury!”
Reviews.Author: MappMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This is truly an amazing place to stay. There was nothing not thought of. We stayed for 5 nights in a JW Suite. We wanted extra space as we took our two children (18m and 3y) We got picked up from the airport with a car organised by the hotel. As we got in to the car we were offered Evian water and a cool facewasher. As we pulled up to the hotel there was a lady waiting for us to escort us straight to our room. With two tired kids it was made so easy. We walked into the room, a really good size for Hong Kong. We had a living room and bedroom. The cot was already set up for our younger child. (Often at other hotels, although i always request a cot when booking it is never in the room when we arrive) As we arrived late this was fantastic service. There was a bowl with two gold fish on the table which our kids loved! We had access to the executive floor. Highly recommend spending the extra to have this option! Especially anyone with kids! Food plenty and really really good. Service was fantastic. As soon as the saw us coming out of the lift the would have everything set up for us exactly how we liked it. The staff were so lovely. They were terrific with the kids. Some hotels find kids all too hard. But they made everything so easy our kids were so well behaved party because of staffs attitude. My favourite thing about the lounge was the Lychee Martinis!!! All the food and drink served in the lounge was really good quality. The lounge was great with the kids as we could take them there for a snack anytime and also their daily milk intake! Plenty of food. The pool are really lovely. Staff, once again fantastic. Nothing too hard. Pool are really lovely. We had a babysitter twice, which was booked through the hotel. It was expensive about $30 an hour or maybe a bit more but she was good with our children and it made leaving them with a stranger a little easier. She bought some toys and some DVD's which kept the kids calm when we walked out the door. The hotel itself is in a great location, connected to a shopping centre which was quite fancy. The hotel was very clean and all staff were fantastic. They went out of there way to make everything perfect. There was always someone to help if you need. They even helped me by pushing the pram with the 18m back to our room while I carried my 3 year old as she was too tired to walk the last 50m! All in all, i have stayed at a lot of hotels and this was the best hotel experience ever! We have been back home for 3 weeks and we still don't stop talking about our experience at the JW Marriott. We plan to go back to Hong Kong (leaving the kids at home, for the first time) and plan to stay their again in a room on the exec floor. I highly recommend this hotel. You wont be disappointed! Another fantastic touch was during the middle of our stay i had organised a late check out at 1pm and when we went to settle the bill on the last morning after breakfast the lady said will 1pm be late enough (for the children to have a sleep). I can make it a bit later if you need. This was so helpful and no other hotel has done that for us! Once again the attention to detail was superb. Thank you! As to the room, it was lovely, bathroom was spacious. House keeping service was exceptional, The room was cleaned daily and then when they came in to do the turn down service we were often out at dinner but at that time they restocked towels and remade bed so perfectly after the girls had a afternoon sleep. Emptied bins etc A big Thanks to the staff in the executive lounge! You made our stay a memorable experience!

Reviews.Title: “luxury personified”
Reviews.Author: shrutivora
Reviews.Content: Right from the reception at the hotel lobby to the room service was extremely welcoming and had that touch of special feeling given. the food served in room dining was by far the nicest indian veg dishes that i have had in Hk. The chef was really helpful and understood what an indian was lookin out for. The room has everythin one can ask for in a luxury hotel....its always clean and upto date.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and loved Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: mandyb64
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had spent most of November in the Far East and really just selected Hong Kong as a good stopover point before we returned to the UK. How we wish we'd stayed there longer! The JW Marriott was, as expected, a great hotel. We loved the location and used the shopping mall attached to the hotel for breakfast. We had a wonderful room with great views. And, as with all JWs, it was well equipped and spotless. Our lasting memory will however be how helpful the staff were. They could not have done more to assist us when we needed help with some complex travel details to visit a friend who lives just outside of Hong Kong; including providing maps and directions in both english and cantonese. And, when they secured our reservation at the "Felix' restaurant, they ensured we had the most amazing table (the food was wonderful, but they could have served me with beans on toast, I was transfixed by the view..) We thought this was a wonderful hotel and we'll definitely visit Hong Kong again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right in the centre of Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: njsmith018
Reviews.Content: We took a family weekend holiday to Hong Kong. 3 nights. Agenda was to take a day at HK Disneyland and then the other time just look around with the family, eat out, and basically chill out. The JW Marriott was a great base for us to do this. You are centrally located near Admiralty station so access to everywhere is easy. The hotel is great. A true 5 star. The service was impeccable. We took an upgrade to a junior suite as there were 4 of us, wife and 2 kids. so we shared 2 queens for sleep and we had the luxury of another room to sit. Had a great view of the harbour. The room was big, the amenities and service were great and were what you would expect from this brand. As part of our deal, we had access to the Executive lounge. This is great when you have young kids. You can go up there for breakfast, afternoon snacks and the most valuable of all evening cocktails. We could have a drink whilst the kids basically had their dinner. Good quality snacks and food. It meant that kids could go to bed whilst adults either got a babysitter and went out or with the other room, we could order up room service and stay in.for dinner by ourselves. The pool facilities were great. All this comes at a cost. I don't think it would be one of the cheaper hotels in HK but you get what you pay for. All in all, a great hotel and i recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Biz Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bojantercon
Reviews.Content: Located right behind the Exhibition and Convention Centre, this is a perfect conference hotel. Built in 89, this it the first Marriott hotel in the Asia Pacific region. With its angular architectural design giving each room a corner window, you have a great view of Victoria Harbour or the Peak, depending what side you’re on. The rooms are on the small side and a little bit tired looking, however, the great location is definitely an asset.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: JPY
Reviews.Content: This hotel can not do enough for you, the staff are fabulous here. Stayed in an executive harbour view room, which was spacious enough for a family of four and a bathroom that was luxurious. The executive level rooms have access to the lounge which is a big benefit. There is a plentiful breakfast and in the early evening snacks and cocktails – all for free. This saved us going out for a meal on a few evenings as we ate so much as a snack! Oh yes, the lounge has equally stunning views of the harbour too. The swimming pool is worth a visit, especially after a hard day sightseeing. There are free pools towels, plush changing rooms and a bar. The hotel above the Pacific Place shopping mall which means it is easily accessible by Admiralty MTR and is only a 20 minute walk across the park to the Peak Tram. Stay here it won’t disappoint

Reviews.Title: “Truely excellent service”
Reviews.Author: bkanipe
Reviews.Content: I spent 10 nights in the HK JW and the service from the staff was second to none. Two areas where they excelled was the personal attention to detail in the Executive Lounge. Knowing your name and anticipating your preferences. The complimentary (in a way) food and drink was better than any ofther JW that I've stayed in. The other area of excellence was the service at the Man Ho chinese restaurant in the hotel. In a word PERFECT. I ate there for dinner twice and each time I left completely satisfied. Can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but ridiculously high prices.”
Reviews.Author: Jimmski
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Rooms are spacious & the beds massive. Lots of nice touches. Well located in a relatively quiet (for HK) area on the borders of Admiralty & Wan Chai. Easy access to the MTR (5 min walk). Staff excellent. There is a lovely swimming pool with good changing & showering facilities. It has all the trappings of a big hotel chain including the price. We used to be able to get rooms here at a rate of about £150 a night (room only) but this has soared to £350 a night which is ridiculous so we now use serviced apartments which are just as well appointed but half the cost. Also these hotels really should provide free internet access in the rooms rather than charging £15 a day rates! Still a good place to stay if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: FamilyoffiveEssexUK
Reviews.Content: If the price puts you off do not worry. Everything yopu get at this hotel is very good value for money. We paid for Executive level access and this was true value for money as the Breakfast was included along woith afternoon tea and hot dinner snack (more like meals)and cocktails every evening.. We found the location and accommodation superb. It was not cheap although when you take into account all of the extras you get it really is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty luxurious for Hong Kong's standard”
Reviews.Author: zephryn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty luxurious, but I will not rate it highly on the value-for-money scale. If you stay here, you'd like to probably spend most of your time using the facilities to make your money worthwhile. Check out the gym - its really good and well-equipped compared to most hotel gyms I've been to. Having said that, this was a company-paid trip. If I were travelling on my own for leisure and I know I will spend most of my time outdoors, I'd probably go for a lower-end and cheaper hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice renovations and great service”
Reviews.Author: roppongi
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel we have stayed in several times since it was new. This most recent trip impressed us- check in was efficient, porter courteous, and concierge was very keen to assist. Complimentary coffee in the morning was excellent. Pool area is not as good as Shang next door, but way way way better than Conrad. (have used all 3 hotels at various times) At HKD1950+ 10% service charge per night I thought it excellent value. Will definately stay here again on the next trip. Ate at Man Ho restaurant and food was excellent- again the renovation was well done.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, convenient, fantastic pool”
Reviews.Author: Nash_Andrew
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is a very nice, high quality hotel conveniently located in Pacific Place in the Admiralty section (near Central) of Hong Kong. It's not quite 5 star but it is extremely nice and I would stay there again. The pros: Incredibly convenient location in Pacific Place - one of the nicer developments in Central, includes a Conrad and Shangri-La hotel as well. Service - not only did everyone fall over themselves to help us, but they were extremely capable. The pool - beautiful, heated, open air pool on an upper floor also has a nice restaurant and hot tub. The cons: Room/bathroom slightly smaller than I'd like considering the price, but this is Hong Kong. The hotel has clearly been updated and does not in any way feel old, but you can tell that it is an older hotel - I'd guess originally early 90s vintage. Overall, this hotel is a great choice for an upscale stay in Hong Kong. If you are looking for a top of the line luxury experience, you should choose the Mandarin Landmark or similar, but otherwise you will not be disappointed here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, well connected, superb service”
Reviews.Author: Traveleator
Reviews.Content: My wife was put up at the Marriott for business and I joined her for an extended weekend. Because she was staying in the hotel for more than two weeks the hotel offered her one of the bigger corner rooms with two double beds, a gesture which we highly appreciated. The hotel is located adjacent to the Pacific Place offices and connected to Admiralty MTR through a subway. The Bank of China Tower and HSBC building were 5 minutes walking distance from Pacific Place exit. The walkway connecting Pacific Place to Queensway Plaza led to the tram stop too. There was a bus stop outside Pacific Place too, so this covered most transport options in HK. The free Airport Express bus shuttle stops at the hotel. The back exit of the hotel led to the superb Hong Kong park which is a great place to unwind after a tough day's work and a short distance from the tram that heads to the Peak. Central, LKF and Wan Chai, were all within walking distance or just a few minutes away by train, tram or bus. Proximity to Pacific Place and Queensway Plaza also meant that there were a lot of eating and shopping options. As for the hotel, its just like most other business hotels in HK, a tall building with a swimming pool, a nice glass lobby and several fine dine restaurants.
