There were several bellhops and ushers waiting to receive you with a smile, help you with luggage and assist you with whatever you may need. The room service was good, tried a few of the room dining options which were tasty. The rooms were cleaned twice a day and no complaints on that front. Our room was big, I believe bigger than the others on our floor (at least that is what appeared from the floor plan hanging behind our door). We had the views of our hotel swimming pool and the mountains from one of our windows, whereas the other overlooked Queensway. We had two double beds in the room, a couple of single seat sofas, a work desk, chair, the regulars, plus a walk in wardrobe and a decent sized bathroom with a bathtub and a separate shower. The bathroom had the usual toiletries and was laid out well. The only odd thing that I spotted was that there were three digital clocks in the room and all three off them showed a different time, though only by a couple of minutes. All in all, a great business hotel, located very close to other businesses and well connected to all modes of public transport.

Reviews.Title: “An out of this world experience!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisNCL
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to stay for three nights while doing all the Hong Kong sights before going onto Disneyland Hong Kong. Location is excellent with covered walkway to Admiralty MTR station making access to the MTR system easy and straightforward. Similarly access to the trams on Hong Kong Island and buses to Stanley and Aberdeen are just a short walk away. Also within an easy walk (15-20 mins) is the Wan Chai Star Ferry terminal for access to Kowloon and a short walk away in the other direction is Hong Kong Park, the Zoo and the Peak Tramway station. As for the hotel you just cannot fault it. The staff are excellent and very attentive. We opted for the deal which included breakfast for 2 adults and 2 children. I have never seen such a choice of food for breakfast - virtually everything you could think of and need to set you up for the day. Our kids were particularly taken by the Haagen Dazs Ice Cream but from freshly made omlettes to smoothie juice drinks you are spoilt for choice. Views of the harbour from the bedrooms are being lost by new building construction but for location, service and overall excellence this hotel, while certainly not cheap, is well worth considering for families as the rooms will comfortably accommodate two adults and two children which is well worth considering as most Hong Kong hotel rooms only accommodate up to three people. Nice outdoor swimming pool too! We would love to go back - perhaps one day!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy in HK”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Crazy_0625
Reviews.Content: Still cherish the memories of stay at J W Marriot HK, with cozy & comfortble stay, even during business trip. Well connected with the city & various travel options availbale for moving nearby. Thank you very much for making our stay so pleasant!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: girishb
Reviews.Content: Love the lobby, its huge and gives lot of difference to the hotel ambience. Though i stayed only for a day it was very comfortable. Room was bit ok only because there was difference in structure and arrangement to it against other hotels i have stayed in. But it was still comfortable. Probably lil expensive for what all you get.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with excellent service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: rubynyla
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and thought this hotel lived up to our expectations. We enjoyed the complimentary beverages in the lobby in the am and had great breakfast choices. The fitness facilities were the best we've seen at a hotel and we were told they're open all day and night. Overall this was a great place to stay. We booked on price line so it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Marriot did not dissapoint”
Reviews.Author: trailblazer88
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I expected from a Marriot Hotel and more. The MTR Admiralty station is located directly beneath the hotel which made it most convenient to travel around Hong Kong. It has the best shower and feels so nice after a hard day of business and sight seeing. Not knowing where to dine, I requested the concierge to recommend me a Middle Eastern restaurant for dinner. The restaurant is located in the hip dining area of Elgin St.. Luckily he made the reservation for me as it turned out that the restaurant was quite packed when I arrived. Thumbs up to Marriot. I will stay here again my next time in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but you do get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: pmechor
Reviews.Content: This may well be one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. The service was excellent from arrival to departure and the rooms were ample and elegant (including complimentary details like fruit, water bottles, a welcome tea, etc.). We had dinner at the Marriott Cafe a couple of times and we found it to be just like the hotel: pricy but very good quality. The staff were all very helpful and knowledgeable and everybody greeted you by your name whenever you were expected: they are clearly very well trained :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent building & location, good service - but still with plenty of areas for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Ede44
Reviews.Content: In the JW Marriott you are really close to the centre of HKG Island - almost everything is walking distance, but the hotel itself is not in the middle of busy traffic - it is next to its competitors Conrad and Island Shangri La. This location is "not for free", particularly not on HKG Island - considering the price level, the service standard, and the offerings of the mentioned competitors nearby the guests summary is: ok, good standard, you get everything you want - but it is not "upper five star level", just "good Marriott standard". This applies to almost every feature: good breakfast, a variety of restaurants, spacious rooms, and reliable and competent service at the reception and concierge desks. But if you walk another 200 meters to the Island Shangri La - just for curiosity - you will feel the difference, it is slightly more expensive, but it is just considerably better. So, if you are not with a very competitive corporate rate, go ahead and pay some HKG dollars more in the Shangri La - if you are in my situation, stay at the Marriott - you are in a good place, you are also a winner when the bill is presented...

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Porters051
Reviews.Content: Every attention is paid to your comfort at this high quality hotel. Ample staff at every door ready to open door, direct taxi, advise on local quirky restaurants (non tourist) or deliver fresh fruit, paper and water each day. We even had our own butler.......all this for a very reasonable price. The cost was approx half some of the other 5 star hotels in Hong Kong. The hotel is located directly on top of a huge modern shopping plaza full of exclusive designer shops and many reasonably priced cafes and restaurants. MTR station directly below the hotel or double decker tram a short walk away ( slower than the MTR but a great way to see the sights). The outdoor pool and jaccuzzi is heated, landscaped and absolutely lovely. We swam in the middle of winter!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice stay but the bathroom was a little cramped”
Reviews.Author: PandaHouston
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here at the JW Marriott Hong Kong in December 2010 as Platinum members. There is an executive lounge on the 33rd floor. We had a corner room on the 32nd floor with a partial view of the harbor. The wifi is only complimentary in the lounge but since our room was right underneath the lounge, we could catch it free from our room. The breakfast was nothing special. Just a few hot items. Although the lounge was 2 floors, there was often not enough seats for people and most of the time there was a wait for breakfast. Throughout the day, the lounge has afternoon tea and snacks. It closes at midnight which was very convenient. We found the room adequate. The only 2 complaints we had was that there was not enough countertop space and the desk felt too small to lay out our things. The bathroom was very small, definitely not enough room for 2 people to stand around. The location was pretty good as the MTR can be accessed via the Pacific Place mall. However, I would look at other cheaper options and especially if you are spending most of your time in Kowloon because we went to Kowloon often and the MTR fares really added up. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone and we had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: RuthB123
Reviews.Content: Lovely and restful hotel in this crowded and chaotic city. Rooms are a tad small, but this is Hong Kong. Service always efficient, and the gym and pool are my favorites to start and end busy Hong Kong days.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every regard”
Reviews.Author: CrispLinen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott for 5 nights en route to India for a wedding. We were booked into 2 executive floors rooms and decided to upgrade to an executive floor harbour view suite. It was the best decision. We had sweeping views of the harbour and the light show at night, fantastic meal presentations throughout the day, and the extra space (700+ sq ft) was crucial as we had three people in the room. If you are thinking you'd be ordering room service or eating meals at the hotel the executive floor is a must. It has a fanstatic array of food in the morning with an Illy espresso coffee machine, 2 floors, multiple juice and soda selections, and wonderful cookies. The suite concierge arranged faboulous tours and restaurant reservations for us and made unbiased decisions about restaurant choices outside the hotel. The rest of the hotel staff is also very attentive. We had arranged for 5 massages when we first arrived and the overwhelming reaction was that Coco was the best massuere. The rates were affordable and the amenties were great...steam, sauna, and jacuzzi. The location of the hotel is perfect with an MTR station underneath the hotel at the Pacific Place ( with tons of the high end shopping ) and the park, botanical gardens, and peak are all within walking distance. Pacific Place is quite impressive with JW, Conrad, Upper House, and Shangri-La all here. The price points for the JW were unparalleled when comparing to the other options and my initial reservation about quality, service, and amenities were immediately resolved once we arrived. I think anyone that has negative things to say about this hotel may have possibly stayed before the 2009 renovations. We all had a great time. Only negative drawback which is completely subjective are the very firm beds.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: travelalotwithfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights. Paid extra to be upgraded to the Executive floors. So glad we did that. Mountain view was stunning. We really enjoyed the food and ocean view from the Executive Lounge. Also tried the buffet from Marriott Cafe one night. It was excellent. Always heard the saying "Home away from home", this is the first time I really get this feeling. On the last day of our stay, all my family members just didn't want to leave. Never had this experience before :-) One thing to add, location of this hotel is perfect. Only a very short walk from the hotel and you're on the MTR platform already, while some other hotels that claim to be close to the MTR but actually need a hike before you can really get on a train.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 5 star, but would stay at others in the area”
Reviews.Author: love2travelTokyo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights on business. Didn't really get much time in the hotel, but did have pretty nice views over the harbour, and all the amenities for 5 star hotel were there, although perhaps starting to get a bit old. Drawbacks were the location - if you work in Central area, it is probably a little bit too far. For a tourist, it is no trouble as it connects in Pacific Place shopping centre and then onto the subway. However, looking at the Upper House next door, would definitely prefer that. Boutique and brand new - very luxurious decor (though I have yet to stay in the room).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in So Many Ways”
Reviews.Author: ShawnTSS
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and fuss free. Hotel attracks lots of corporate customers but has a lot to offer to leisure guests too. JW benefits from excellent connectivity to integrated Pacific Place mall and the Admiralty MTR station. Tram and bus services also easily accessible. Room amenities were perfectly fine and size was spacious by HK standards. All in, highly recommended, budget permitting.

Reviews.Title: “Corporate only”
Reviews.Author: Jimbotrip
Reviews.Content: While there is nothing really wrong with this place (clean, friendly etc), it has all the charm of staying in an American Airlines airport lounge. The whole time you are here, you just have that nagging feeling that for the price, you know there is better.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Loved it. Would stay again ANYTIME”
Reviews.Author: travelinpdx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott Hong Kong for our 9th Anniversary and just had a blast. We loved the hotel, the rooms, the service, the fitness center, the pools, and probably best of all, the executive lounge. The food was great throughout the day and the service throughout the hotel, but especially in the lounge was TOP NOTCH. Many other hotels could learn a lesson from the JW Marriott. We stayed on there with points and were not given an upgrade despite me being Gold with Marriott, however, I understand the hotel was completely booked full during our stay, but again, having access to the lounge helped so much. One downside, the internet in the lounge seemed extremely slow for what I would have expected in Hong Kong. Also, having the hotel right on top of a mall, grocery store, and the MTR really was helpful. Lastly, if you need to catch the airport express to the airport, DO NOT TAKE THE FREE SHUTTLE from Marriott back to Hong Kong station. It takes forever, just walk from Admiralty to Hong Kong station. It's about a 10 minute walk, or a 25 minute bus ride. I was very nervous we would miss our flight because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient, good service”
Reviews.Author: ZED2010
Reviews.Content: One of the most convenient and nice hotels to choose in HK for any business stay. It is also recommanded for leisure as it is located in center city and well equipped. The staff is very friendly and professional, the pool is nice and the view is excellent,

Reviews.Title: “Over priced!”
Reviews.Author: KenS8888
Reviews.Content: A faded hotel in Pacific Place. Fine if you can get substantial concession to surrounding hotels. Otherwise just sort of makes you mad to think how much you are paying for such a poor experience. No free internet, second rate buffet at same price as Shangri La's excellent spread. Nice fish sandwich at pool bar though...

Reviews.Title: “4* Marriott, needs gentle face lift”
Reviews.Author: bonoglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Pros: this is a standard busy business/tourist class Marriott. The club rooms had a good spread of food and drink (no premium alcohol though). Well appointed rooms, good views if you had a harbour view room - but am not sure its worth the extra charge. One of few hotels in central HK with an outdoor pool which was why I booked it. Relatively good location. Cons: felt very 90s or even 80s compared to the Mandarin Oriental HK which was only marginally more expensive. The premium harbour view rooms were tight. Lots of business travellers and tour groups. The club rooms were often filled with large noisy groups of people with rampaging children. Pool area was very mediocre - reminded me of a tired 80s hotel. Its clean, comfortable, with an OK location (you need to walk a bit to catch the tram/ tube or you'll have to cab it everywhere). A good middle of the road, mid-budget option if you can get a significant discount. Else its a bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location . . . great service!”
Reviews.Author: Mis_Adventurous
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the JW Marriott in Pacific Place. The hotel is in a prime location with access to several restaurants, shopping, and the MTR (subway). We had four people staying in one room . . . it was a little cramped, but it worked. The rooms are nicely appointed and we were pleased to find that the staff from doormen to the front desk were as attentive as ever. I would like to caution this hotel on the need to continue holding high standards on the cleanliness of the rooms. There was something "odd" on the carpet when we arrived, which was quickly taken care of, but should have been noticed by the cleaning staff before we arrived. The same holds true for the glassware in the room. Other than that, the hotel is a gem and would be a choice for us to stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff & Location”
Reviews.Author: hoops7k
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights. The location of the hotel is great. Close to mtr and on top of a shopping mall. The stay was great. They gave me updates on the coming typhoon and offered suggestions. The rooms are nice but oddly shaped. The tv has a unorthodox viewing angle. You have to pull it out and move it to be seen from the bed. The internet was very fast. The only issue I had was the room did not have a power adapter. I had to call down for it and it was quickly brought to my room.

Reviews.Title: “A Great business hotel strategically located”
Reviews.Author: Mishra02
Reviews.Content: My frequent business travel has carried me across continents, and I would like to share my experience at the JW Marriott. The JW Marriott Hong Kong is situated in Central Hong Kong and has a locational advantage as it is very close to the shopping areas but more importantly to the offices. Also getting around HK via the MTR, Taxi or the tram is very convenient from here. The room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TomBamber
Reviews.Content: 75 minutes from touch down to check at the hotel in via the Airport Train Link set the scene for an efficient and customer focused stay. From greeting at the door to check out, all aspects of the hotel service were excellent and I could not fault the attentiveness and professionalism of the staff. Food and beverage is excellent, the outdoor swimming pool and amenities superb. The location, as part of the Pacific Place complex is excellent due to its proximity to the financial district. My one niggle was being allocated a non-smoking room which was normally used as a smoking room - this was evident due to the smell of stale smoke. This was raised with the reception staff who apologised but were unable to do anything due to the high occupancy. All in all, a very good hotel in an excellent location and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Goodservice but small room”
Reviews.Author: Suwatss
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at JW Marriott for the first time for my 2-day business trip in Hong Kong. The hotel has a great service, gorgeous decoration, convenient location at Pacific place mall and Admiralty subway station. However I find tha room space is quite small and the layout is not good. I feel a little uncomfortable for the room layout and still think that at this price other places may be worth more for value. Breakfast has quite a good variety of food but the service at the counter was not good. I had to wait for a while before someone come to serve me for the cooking. Business center is good with computers and printers for my presentation printing at no charge. In sum I think next time I may stay at other hotels where the location will be closer to business center (like Mandarin) or closer to causeway bay where I find the area is more convenient for food and shopping than JW.

Reviews.Title: “It was good”
Reviews.Author: ApurvaJhalani
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good. The room service was good and very prompt. The location of the hotel is very convinient. It is well connected. The stay was pleasant. The overall experience was good and one can look at staying at the hotedl. Only one suggestion would be that they need to have vegetarian menu so that Indians can have some options for food.

Reviews.Title: “Oy. Small rooms. Needs refurb. Pass.”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid88
Reviews.Content: So, this is not a bad hotel, but, for the price, there are so many more choices in HK. As others have said: - rooms are small and the pointed shape makes them less functional and the entry hallway is tight - the ventilation system was old and rumbling all night - the water pipes from the floor above emitted loud screeching sounds for 15 minutes (after midnight) - mattress is beyond firm - very dated fittings For the first time in 5 years, after a sleepless night, I checked myself out of a hotel after the first night and into another the next day. What an improvement!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay again”
Reviews.Author: mw104
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the JW Marriott and again we were very happy - as Gold Marriott members we got upgraded to a club level harbour view room. The hotel is in a great location from which to tour HK, the rooms are well furnished, the beds comfortable, the bathroom well equipped and the the offerings in the club lounge very good as usual.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking but uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: Cannuck_chick
Reviews.Content: My frequent business travel has carried me to each of the continents, with approximately 30 short haul trips and 10 overseas trips completed per year. I usually make an effort to stay at a Marriott hotel as their membership benefits exceed many other programs, and this trip was no exception. The JW Marriott Hong Kong is situated in Central Hong Kong minutes from great shopping and more importantly, my office building. The hotel is breathtakingly beautiful with a mix of both Asian and North American charm. There are several restaurants offering a wide selection of dishes. I strongly recommend the sushi from the JW California Restaurant and Sushi Bar, and of course, no Sunday morning would be complete without a visit to Man Ho Restaurant for some authentic Chinese Dim Sum. The hotel is respectful of changes to guests travel clocks and has formulated their room service menu to allow patrons to order from either a breakfast of dinner menu at any point throughout the day. The actual hotel room was spacious with a view of Hong Kong Harbor. The television was very large and had an arm extension allowing it to be placed back into the wall unit. The bathroom was large and clean, containing both a bath tub and a separate stand up shower. The room was replenished daily with all required amenities, from the usual bath products to a bucket of bath salts and a loofa sponge. Complimentary water and fruit was delivered every day. The only negative point in the room was the mattress quality. The bed was too firm for my liking which resulted in a poor nights sleep. The health club was clean and comfortable and contained all of the equipment needed to have a good workout. The locker rooms were equipped with both a steam room and a sauna to help you relax after your workout. There was also a tanning bed available which I did not have an opportunity to use. Hotel staff was incredibly helpful and delivered exceptional service. In the health club, the staff would provide you with cool towels as you completed your workout or finished using the sauna. The front desk staff was very efficient and had everything processed within a matter of minutes. This I appreciated to no extend as I checked in at 4am after an eighteen hour flight. Overall I would rate this hotel as one of the best hotels for service, atmosphere and food. If they would replace their mattresses, it would be a complete 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mistycat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with my husband, booked a harbour view room as we celebrating my 50th. When we were taken to our room it wasn't harbour view, this was quickly rectified by the staff and we were promptly escorted to a harbour view room. The room was nice, clean , good large TV, all the amenities you would expect. The breakfast was nice with huge bowls of fresh raspberries, blueberries and strawberries, smoothies to order etc. The waffle/pancake station was woeful with the girl obviously not coping and very slow however the lady in charge would be there and let you know she would bring it over when it was ready. My husband really enjoyed the gym, but commented the pool didnt have much atmosphere. Besides breakfast we didnt eat in the hotel as there was too much on offer else where. The location is good for the MRT and shopping but I prefer Causeway Bay or Mongkok so will probably not stay at the JW again. A nice touch was a exceptional box of chocolates left in our room with a birthday card for me, nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel, only Breakfast could be better”
Reviews.Author: tsturm30
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very nice, big Lobby and Bar, good Restaurant. Rooms are all clean and shiny, you have a 42"+ Flat TV for watching movies. If you got lucky you also have a beautiful view across the Harbor to Kowloon. The Fitness Center is top notch, everything you need. Underneath the Hotel is the Metro and a Supermarket with Food Court.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: VillanOfBrum
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW HK for 4 nights recently. Room was on the 23rd floor with a view of the harbour. Excellent service from the staff and the room was very well equipped and maintained. The location is superb and getting around HK via the MTR, Taxi or the tram was simple from here. From the airport we used the Airport Express service which took us by train to central and from there its a free ride on the shuttle bus to JW HK. I would recommend this hotel as a great place to stay in HK

Reviews.Title: “probably the best hotel experience I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: thornthwaite
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was almost faultless. The staff are incredibly helpful and genuinely friendly. The cleanliness was impeccable and the room service was so speedy and efficient. The only thing that wasn't perfect was the location as it was a little far out from the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, one of the good hotels in hkg”
Reviews.Author: atul_mukhi
Reviews.Content: Hotel is good overall, swimming pool is good, views are panaromic. Location is perfect, its on top of Pacific Place at Admilty MTR station ( One of the best shopping malls in hkg).

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: livans74
Reviews.Content: Good location, good food, very clean, nice rooms and beautiful view from the room

Reviews.Title: “Great on location”
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hoteol for a couple of nights,great reception and concierge staff but the hotel rooms are very tiny.The shape of the rooms also is very wierd. The location is great and the hotel has a good basis generally.I guess the hotel need a refurrb of accomnmodation units.Food is great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but a little dated - and much construction between hotel and harbor”
Reviews.Author: lucyandethel
Reviews.Content: Reading the other reviews, it seems that others are impressed by what I consider standard in 5-star Asia hotels....excellent service, electric curtains, premium bed linens This hotel has all of those. It's also in a great location - on top of an MTR station (Admiralty) and as a Marriott Platinum I enjoyed the lounge on the 33rd floor (the breakfast was termed continental but was a full breakfast.... great wine in the afternoon, good snacks etc). Service, like in the rest of Asia, was impeccable. So why 3 stars? First off, I agree with the other reviewer who said the hotel is beginning to look a bit "dated" - very 90s. The rooms are VERY small, even by HK standards. Beyond Marriott's control is that a large building is being constructed in front of the hotel. We moved to 33 to see "over" the building, but it's not yet done. I don't think there are going to be many harbor view rooms in another 6-12 months. As a point of comparison, When I got to HK (frequently), I stay at the Langham Place, The Langham, the Intercontinental, and the Sheraton. I think the Langham Place delivers best value for money and also a sense of style and humor that makes it feel a bit like a boutique hotel even though it's 42 stories tall! Overall, the JW is a decent but not outstanding hotel. If you're used to Four Seasons, Ritz, etc, this JW isnt going to compare to those - the rooms just are too small. But the hotel has much to offer and may suit you just fine.

Reviews.Title: “fancy and clean but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: imfletcher72
Reviews.Content: if you can get a low rate at this hotel stay here. i used to stay in TST, Kowloon at the Renaissance Kowloon but as that hotel has closed i tried the Renaissance on HK island but wasn't impressed so this time i splurged and paid a bit more for the JW. the hotel is very clean and modern and lovely. it has a GREAT gym and an equally strong concierge lounge. my only complaint would be that my room was a little small and since there is a huge 42" tv on the wall right by the bed i had a difficult time sleeping at night with the tv on (which i sometimes like to do) as it was so huge and bright and right in my face. this hotel is also connected to the pacific place mall - which is good for a movie, some fancy shopping, or a bunch of meal options - only problem being that it's a mall that could be anywhere in the U.S. (kinda vanilla).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, solid all rounder.”
Reviews.Author: FatcatJunketeer
Reviews.Content: Got off to a rocky start with the Marriott global reservations team but they resolved the issues in the end. Stayed for 3 nights in a standard room, although relatively small, it had wrap-around windows with views of the city and was nicely furnished. Oddly shaped to maximise the glasshouse design/views but it didnt feel too cramped for a short stay. Elec drapes were a nice touch and the views are rather nice even though they're of the city and not the harbour. Massive TV and DVD player. No ipod dock though but theres an ancient Bose stereo/clock. Wifi was HKD120 a day; should be free of course but at least it was relatively reasonable. Nice bathroom well stocked with amenities including Nirvae toiletries. Beds were very comfy and comp water is always a nice touch. Great location right on top of Pacific Place. Shops and trains just a short walk away. Plenty of taxis at the door, except for rush hour of course. Took their car service to the airport, took less than 25 mins and they had free wifi in the car. Not uber luxurious but still quite nice and looks younger than its 20 years. Its not cheap but hotels in HK are rather pricey. Although the rooms are smaller, it's a better choice than the Conrad next door.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: loichelle
Reviews.Content: real nice location, for easy access to the station and shopping mall, but their service isn't very nice. I just told them that i will be using japanese appliances and they only brought me the adapter without the converter. I was in a rush and charged my stuff then broke one of my electronic stuff. Called them again and explained the situation, then they brought me the converter. I don't expect bringing both converter and adapter would be that hard to think when they work at international hotel. Also, when we were about to leave the hotel, we were going to get on a cab, but the bellboy asked us if we are going to the HK station, and we said yes, then they put us on a free shuttle bus. I was still curious if it would be quicker so asked them if it will be quick. they said yes. only 15 min. then the buys started going around all the other hotels etc... it wouldn't be the choice we had chosen since we were in a rush...

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: crossborderre
Reviews.Content: Comfortable 5 star hotel. They got my suit pressed from in between flights in 10 minutes flat - I was late and desperate on my way to another meeting. After business trips to many countries, on my last leg in asia, very refreshing to press a button next to bed to have my window drapes close and my lights turned off. Very good location, the gym exceeded my expectations. The pool area was wonderful, I wish I had the chance to take advantage, but only for wine and a salad given my schedule. Would return upon next trip to Hong Kong without a second thought. Again, I wish the western world's service industry could take some lessons here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zmastercanada
Reviews.Content: I needed to be in Hong Kong for business for almost 3 week (end of June/beginning of July 2010), staying at the JW Marriott and have nothing but praise for this hotel. Its proximity to the Island Line MTR station (at Admiralty) made getting to the office very easy (no transfers & was only outside for ~50m, which was good for this time of year). And on a couple of evening I took the tram back from the office rather than the train, while 2-3 time the travel time sitting on the top level of the tram showed several places to explore. Since I am "Marriott Gold", I had access to their lounge for breakfast & snacks, its the best Marriott lounge I'd been in (quality/selection of food, drinks, service) with a great view of the harbour. Many of my colleagues stayed at the Sheraton in Kowloon (as they were Sheraton Gold), they paid about the same room rate but had a much less convenient commute (& more crowded train). As for my room, it was basically what everyone else described and very well decorated. We did have a couple of quirks, since my wife was with me but working from the hotel, we were short a bit of power (but we were running 2 laptops, a routers & 2 VoIP phones but who else but us would be traveling with that much gear & the desk space was even sufficient for the 2 of us). While it may seem a bit strange to give a hotel in this price range '5' for value, given the price & level of service it is great value. BTW - some one else mentioned that if you were taking the Airport Express to get off at Kowloon Station & take the MTR, not sure why as there is a shuttle from the Hong Kong station (a few feet from where you get off the train) that goes to the front door of the JW Marriott every 20 min. Taking the MTR from the Kowloon Station to the JW Marriott means a 2 transfers & a walk to get to the Admiralty station & another walk to the lobby of the Marriott to checkin).

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service/ Attention to Detail”
Reviews.Author: lcarpenter08
Reviews.Content: Perhaps this is characteristic of most hotels in Hong Kong, however I was very much delighted with everything during my stay at the JW Marriott. I was there for a conference in April (staying 7 nights) and flew in from NYC. Barely had any sleep on the 15 hour flight, but upon arriving at the JW Marriott, everything was taken care of smoothly (bags, check-in, etc.) and done so with such care. Staff was extremely attentive, friendly and helpful (more so than at any other hotel I've experienced in the states). Ordered room service for breakfast numerous times which came very promptly (within 15-20 min). Very conveniently located above the metro station. Room was impeccably made every evening when I returned (and I'm not a very tidy traveler, so I was shocked to find all articles of clothing neatly folded and organized, suitcases sitting on their stands). Overall, wonderful experience and stay; can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, both for business and for leisure”
Reviews.Author: pramod1
Reviews.Content: I stayed there during one of my business meetings, but regreted not bringing family along. This hotel has a very good combination of meeting the needs of a business traveler and of someone on a leisure trip. Very luxurious and plush rooms, wide selection available for food and not too far from HK downtown. My joggers colleagues had a great time there, since the hotel is on a hilly area. Overall, we all were very happy staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: GalaxyPareshkaria
Reviews.Content: Hotel is having good rooms and interior design. I was impressed with fitness facilities. The morning break fast manu was very comprehensive and it delighted my taste.

Reviews.Title: “Top rate hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Panguin
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with first class service. The location is excellent, being almost on top of the subway Admiralty Station. (BTW, if you are taking the Airport Express train, stop at Kowloon and then take the MTR to Admiralty Station.) I travelled with my family so they were well occupied. The restaurants in the hotel itself and the Pacific Place mall are very good. The Man Ho Chinese restaurant is award-winning but alas its prize also matches. I had a corner room that I thought looked bigger on the floor plan than the regular room. HK hotel rooms are tiny so I was grateful for the room that could accommodate two double bed. My room was not noisy. The bathroom was also sizeable--WC on the left, bathtub AND shower stall on the right; sink in the middle. No real complaints except that the non-smoking floor had a faint odour of smoke. I would definitely stay here again with the caveat that I will ask for a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “5-star! Absolutely faultless!”
Reviews.Author: Lavillion
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW Marriot a couple of weeks back. What could i say except it's absolutely amazing and exceeded all expectations! Beautifully appointed room with a spacious bathroom. Everything is carefully thought for in this hotel. The bathroom has a full set of quality amenities from shampoo, conditioner, bath salts to the leather jewelry box. The bed is huge and plush with the softest duvet cover to ensure a good night's sleep! The linens will be changed daily too if you like! Wide screen TV and Bose sound system - how could i complain ! In-room dining service is great too and delicious! The evening turn down service is a nice touch - it's great to go out shopping in the afternoon and come back later to find an impeccably made-up room. The heated pool looked quite small so we didn't try to take a dip which we regret later as we moved to Harbour Plaza Metropolis after 1 week stay at Marriot and the pool at Harbour Plaza is freezing cold!! Now i understood why the Marriot pool is heated. I would absolutely recommend anyone to stay at the Marriot. I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott Hong Kong made my parents' 45th anniversary very special”
Reviews.Author: sputnika
Reviews.Content: My parents are celebrating their 45th wedding anniversary after a challenging year of health problems, and the hotel staff made our vacation special. LOCATION The JW Marriott might be a surprise choice for leisure travelers, but its location right on top of Pacific Place Mall, with access to the adjacent Admiralty subway station, is spot on. One can go anywhere by Metro-- Central and Causeway Bay and Tsim Sha Tsui are easily accessible, and cabs are easy to catch. It is a long walk or a quick cab ride to the HK Academy for the Performing Arts, and the Convention Center beyond it. Ocean Park buses leave from Admiralty Station too. There are dining options at the hotel and in Pacific Place and the nearby Star Street. A Watsons drug store at Pacific Place is handy for things travelers need. The dining options are decidedly gourmet rather than discount, to go with the designer stores, but those with champagne tastes on a beer budget can take their pick at the Great Food Hall at the lower level of Pacific Place. This food supermarket has a great selection of food- fruit, ready to eat cuisine from around the world, cheese, chocolate, a gelateria, wonderful produce and seafood, even an olive oil bar and more things we could not take home. You can even score some foie gras if you feel like it. (Thanks to Marissa who helped us pick some items that we could take home with us.) For Catholics, Star Street also has a Catholic Church housed in a modern tower block. SERVICE Right after I booked our stay online, the hotel's confirmation email was filled with helpful hints, weather reports, and offers on how to make our stay comfortable. We booked limousine service via the hotel, and so top notch service began from the moment we exited from airport customs. THE SWEETEST THING: Steven Lo, Guest Relations Manager, sent up a tray of milk (on ice), chocolate, and cookies with a pretty greeting card after he found out that my parents were celebrating their anniversary. The everyday service was excellent. Executive Level booking allowed us to be welcomed by Tiffani and checked in directly in our room. Coolio and other staff members helped us with our luggage and our other needs, seemingly arriving like a genie when we needed them after a day exploring the city. The Executive Lounge concierge desk under Noel Arevalo's supervision helped us plan our excursions and took care of our travel arrangement questions. Agnes gave us the weather report and directed us to the wonders of Great Food Hall, among others. Helen took care of writing out our destinations in Chinese for our cab rides. Everyone was very helpful, all the way to express check-out with Caroline. The Lounge wait staff- Vanessa, Lorna, Minda, Tess, and others- were very welcoming. Going for Executive Level was well worth it for the Wi Fi and the dining options. For senior citizens or tired travelers, or even busy business folks, the generous nibbles for breakfast and evening cocktails were a good way to start and end a day of exploration (or work) without the effort of going out. The coffee was excellent, and the spread was well-chosen each day. My parents were definitely spoiled by the experience- the JW Marriott set a new bar for service. ROOM The rooms are 31 square meters, perhaps small but normal and comfortable by Hong Kong standards. But they do not feel tight at all because two sides are picture windows, with drapes that could be conveniently drawn at the press of a button next to the bed. In our case, we had a view of the mountains and some nearby towers (including the Conrad and the Island Shangri-La on the same complex), with birds swooping by. For seniors with difficulty getting in and out of a tub, it was a nice touch that the shower stall was separate from the tub. The toiletries (Nirvae botanicals) were also good- we especially liked the orange and sandalwood lotion. The desk was well-equipped for work, with stationery items like highlighters and sticky pads and staplers, in case one forgot to bring them along. Free in-room Internet access would have been nice, but the Executive Lounge was conveniently nearby anyway. (I don't know why a lot of high-end hotels do not offer free Internet, while, for example, the mom-and-pop places on Panglao Island in Bohol made the length of Alona Beach essentially one long Wi Fi zone.) BTW, the Executive Lounge also had computer stations for those who are not packing their own gear. BEST: Service LEAST: hard to think of one, but maybe, for Hong Kong, a better or wider selection of dim sum in the cocktail spread might be nice. (The hotel has a good Chinese restaurant downstairs.)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service...a little noisy perhaps?”
Reviews.Author: Davo666
Reviews.Content: In keeping with the local culture, you're made to feel special as soon as you arrive here. The attention given to each and every individual made be considered by some as too 'hands on', but personally I enjoyed this (it's all too rare in Europe!) The entire hotel is kept beautifully clean and there is real attention to detail on presentation (from the rooms to the restaurants) The food is also excellent and the choice varied. The only problem I encountered was the level of noise. From people noisily returning to their rooms late at night, to sounds of showers being run above and below, there doesn't seem to be much of a 'cushion' between rooms and this made for some sleepless nights. The bed was also very hard and this did not help matters! All in all though, a good place to stay for business or leisure, and I would probably look to return here on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, great service, property falling a bit behind competitors”
Reviews.Author: NYC304
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott Hong Kong was probably one of the better hotels in the city not so long ago. Unfortunately, the property is showing it's age a bit - more in terms of design than wear and tear. The location is very convenient for just about anything you could want to do in Hong Kong. The public areas are nice and the rooms clean and well-kept. The service was 5-star. All of that said, the property is looking a little tired. The fixtures and furniture could be updated a bit. In the same area at Pacific Place, you can also find much newer hotels such as the Conrad, the Shangri-La and the Upper House. They are way ahead of the JW Marriott. Here are some specifics: Room: Small but that's to be expected in Hong Kong. Bathroom vanity was too small and crowded for my make-up items. Closet was fairly big. Great view, neat electric curtains. Staff kept turning the AC setting up to a warmer temperature when they made up the room - so much so that it was uncomfortable every time I returned. Restaurants: Only had breakfast at the JW Cafe. Very good buffet breakfast. For means and drinks, it's much nicer to go to the nearby entrance to the Upper House and enjoy the views from Cafe Gray. Pool: Nice, outdoor, gets some sun but often crowded in the morning. Odd shape makes it hard for more than a couple of people to swim laps at the same time. Service: Very good, very polite, always helpful - particularly given the large numbers of people going through each day.

Reviews.Title: “One more 5-star Hong Kong Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goncalo2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night in a standard room and I found it a bit noisy because of the road traffic, but there may be quieter sides in the hotel. Although HK is a noisy city I can't remember of any hotel there with double windows or double glazing in the bedrooms, which is unfortunate. The Marriot is a standard HK 5-star hotel, which is a very high standard, but it is not the kind of hotel where I will return again and again. The location is good, especially if you want to do some shopping, as you have direct access to the Pacific Place mall where you can find lots of great brands (Churchs, Lane Crawford, Brooks Brothers, Seibu, Hermés, Ferragamo, etc.). You are also close to the subway and at in a walking distance from Central district.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Expected more in terms of service & room size”
Reviews.Author: Belly2007
Reviews.Content: JW Marriott is perfectly located at the Pacific Place Mall which has the Admiralty MTR station connected to it. However, if I had a choice again, I'd probably stay at the Upper House, which is beside the JW Marriott. My friend stayed at the Upper House which had much bigger rooms, free bottled water from some French mountain, unlimited M&Ms and snacks, and REN toiletries. We paid much more per night at JW Marriott. Location: Good as it is connected to the mall and Admiralty MTR Service: We asked them to clean our room and after 2 hours, nobody had come yet to clean. Room: The room is very small and claustrophobic. Sleep Quality: They have a nice selection of pillows but for some reason, they were all the type that go very very flat when you lie on them so you need to have at least 2 pillows underneath your head. Overall, I would choose to stay at Park Lane most likely, as it is cheaper and has bigger sized rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Base for Exploring Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: bagsalwayspacked
Reviews.Content: Intro: We spent 3 weeks in HK and China in May with my son, who had just graduated from college, and his Chinese fiancé, who was about to graduate from college in China. We recommend going there in the fall or spring. Winter nights can be cold and miserable for sightseeing, and the summer is tropical. This is the first review of the hotels we visited. We have included info about HK as well. Location: The JW is beautifully situated above the high end Pacific Place Mall and surrounded by skyscrapers, which can make you feel a bit trapped at times if you are like I and are from some desolate place like West Texas. It is convenient to reach by Metro, which serves most of the places you will want to visit. The very tall Conrad and Shangri-La Hotels are across the street. Hong Kong JW Rooms: We used Marriott Rewards points for two rooms during our stay of 5 nights. (Our son and his fiancé had a separate room with a city view.) Room 1502- We had to take two queen beds because that was all they had with any view of the water. There room smelled modly when we arrived, but we were too jetlagged to do anything about it. A/C ran nonstop, and it still smelled moldy. Had A/C repaired second day, and it still ran 24/7. We requested another room after 2 nights. (My engineer husband certifies hospital OR’s for humidity, etc., and said the HVAC system drain was plugged and would take a major effort to repair.) Room 1205- A/C ran just fine…not that often and room did not smell musty. With the A/C off, we could hear the highway traffic 15 floors below us. King bed was wonderful, and we had a view of the water. Fridges in both rooms were great for storing cold drinks and yogurt. Unless you want to remain fully dressed, the sheers covering the huge windows gave some privacy during the day as most of us are not accustomed to having 100,000 or so folks staring in our windows from the skyscrapers too close by. Concierge Lounge: It was outstanding, especially for breakfast and just relaxing. We had luscious scrambled eggs and very thin bacon every morning with fresh fruit and so much more to choose from. Lots of ice and cold drinks as well as fresh juice and yogurt were available in the fridge. The staff were superb and beyond helpful. We really appreciated them after we checked into the Shanghai JW, which did not have the same level of service. Concierge dinners tended to be on the starchy side with lots of carbs, but Sunday night had wonderful sliced lamb and pork. The desserts were to kill for, especially the vanilla custard/crème brulee type filling with raspberry puree topping. Lots of Chinese food as well. Staff were quite attentive and spoke great English as did most the folks that we met in HK. In the Concierge Lounge, we met some very friendly guests from all over the world, and they each had interesting things to share. There are two computers available there and free wireless. There were books and music CD’s to borrow and lots of room to spread out and relax. The free newspapers and fantastic views were also great. We did not try the hotel restaurants because we were out sightseeing around lunch time and the concierge lounge food more than met our needs the rest of the time. Gym: Excellent choice of workout machines and staff that knew how to provide custom exercises with the equipment on hand. I needed leg adduction and abduction exercises, and they showed me how to do them without the machines in my regular gym. You will need to workout if you are eating the luxurious concierge lounge food! Pool: Incredible outdoor pool for laps although it can get busy on weekends. Empty during weekday business hours. Staff are extremely helpful offering water bottles and towels when they walk by. If you are a small to medium sized person, you can buy Tyr black swim suits at the pool. Otherwise bring a decent suit because you won’t easily find your size in Hong Kong. Weekend Free Tai Chi classes at 9.30AM in the pool area: This was our first tai chi class, and we loved it. It felt great to stretch the day after a 15 hour flight. The instructor was patient with us five beginners, and the pool landscaping and view are unbelievable. Where to go in Hong Kong: Our first choice is the Museum of Art. The Wu Guanzong modern painting exhibit on the top floor was first class. The gift shop offers prints of many of the paintings. The second floor calligraphy and third floor porcelain statues will make your heart beat faster they are so captivating. We visited this museum twice, which is something we rarely do. Lunch in the café was excellent; we had the pork chop special for 8USD, and one meal would have been plenty for two people. In nice weather you can sit on the lovely sculpture garden patio and enjoy the view of Hong Kong Island across the water. Please allow extra time for this museum, shop and café. Peak Tram Visit: Like every other tourist in HK, we took the Peak Tram just before sunset and spent 3 hours on top of the Peak. For the asocial, gourmand crowd, the Peak Lookout restaurant patio has a wonderful view of the harbor with no buildings obstructing the view. This will make you feel like you are in Micronesia or Hawaii, and not surrounded by 7 million pushy consumers. Be prepared for the long death march through zillions of stores as you circle umpteen times to take escalators up through each level of the main building on the Peak to the rooftop lookout. There must be a way to fake a handicap and take an elevator up because if you are not a shopper, this can be the tour from hell and calls for a tranquilizer before hand to survive the crowds. We wish someone had told us this before we endured this form of torture. If anyone in your group has a fear of heights or crowding, this is not the place to take them. Buy the video and stay away. It is not the place to have a major behavioral meltdown as I did just putting my head in my lap and enduring two hours of noisy, smoky hell after a lovely quiet meal on the patio. Beware that the smoke from the Burger King at the top is quite strong at the viewpoint. This has to be one of the worst places in the world for a smoky fast food dive. If you want a clear photo from the top, good luck. The clouds and haze are pretty much continuous, and the crowds at the railings ruin most of your shots. Take a full size tripod and stand on the highest level, not next to the rails below. We stayed in HK five days hoping to get a clear shot from the top, but it was cloudy/hazy most of each day. If you are quite lucky and the gods are willing, the views of city night lights are astounding from the top. Traveling from HK to Shanghai our next stop: There is an easy way; just take a plane from HK airport to Shanghai. It is expensive because this is priced as an international flight. Or if it is not raining and you have the time, you can spend 3 hours riding three different buses from HK to Shenzen where we caught a plane to Shanghai. We saw some amazing views during the 3 bus rides to the Shenzen airport; the roads circle HK about ten times it seems, and the views are stunning much of the time. HK is one of the largest ports we have seen anywhere in the world. The bus switches from the left hand side of the road to the right when you leave HK and enter China, so you change buses after you clear customs at the border. Yup, HK is a separate country from mainland China, whose citizens must get a very restricted visa for a max of 7 days to visit HK. Star Ferry ride from HK Island to Kowloon: We loved this short trip; take a hooded rain jacket as it can be quite windy and cool on the open ferry in the water even on a typical hot, muggy HK day. Before the outstanding Metro arrived, everyone took the Star Ferry, and it did seem like a visit to ancient times. The Metro: We loved riding the Metro because it is so beautifully built, and we don’t have one at home. Take the JW elevator downstairs to the lovely mall below the hotel, and you will see signs to the Metro. It reminded us of the wonderful subway systems in Seoul and Tokyo. Rambling through Kowloon: Do allow at least a half day to take the escalator up the main hill in Kowloon. There are wonderful galleries and lots of restaurants for relaxing. You will have to stumble down the steep hill or get a taxi back, but sights are hard to beat. Be prepared to see more of humanity than you may desire. Most of HK history was violent, and historic structures have been replaced with neck breaking skyscrapers on most blocks. In closing: A fall or spring visit to HK can be a real treat with a stay at the JW. Take your workout clothes and swimsuit as well as sturdy hiking shoes and be prepared for a very physical trip. HK is not the place for folks who cannot walk uphill or do lots of stairs. We really looked forward to returning to the safe, comfortable cocoon at the JW after a day of rambling around HK. This hotel provided a fantastic base for the first part of our China vacation.

Reviews.Title: “5 STAR ALL THE WAY!”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne M
Reviews.Content: I usually have pics to post with all of my reviews however photos could not describe this amazing experience at the JW Marriott. There is nothing that you could possibly need that cannot be brought to you by any of the amazing, professional staff. From the moment be arrived, it was 1st class service and ammenities all the way around. This hotel is immaculate, clean, beautiful and sound proof! The rooms had a grand view of Hong Kong with the curtains accesible to shut with just a button by your bed. Fresh fruit in the room everyday and wonderful cleaning staff. A big shopping mall is attached to the hotel. Location is perfect and accessible to every train in Hong Kong. Taxis are always available too from the front drop off point of the hotel. Amazing experience, well worth the price and thensome! we will return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Standard 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FoxMulder0
Reviews.Content: A comfortable business hotel with adjoining shopping centre, views of the harbour and excellent connectivity. Nice breakfast spread.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: CBangkok
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights on our urgent trip to Hong Kong. Room was very clean as most 5-star hotels standard. Great location. Excellent concierge helping us rescheduled our flight just hours before the flight time.

Reviews.Title: “The View Is Amazing...”
Reviews.Author: Kimichi033
Reviews.Content: Me and my family went to JW Marriot in the Winter time, the view from the room was amazing and the room was very clean as well. I liked how the room had a window going around two sides of the room rather than one side. Sometimes it gets very foggy and you can't see many things. The nightlife is amazing. All the lights along the streets you can see from the window are amazing. The bathroom is very clean and it is a respectable size. The bath tub was very clean for our standards. It is easy access to the train as it is underneath the hotel. The hotel is connected to a mall wich made it convienient when you needed to buy breajfast in the early morning. The beds were very comfortable and it kept you warm through the night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Strabo
Reviews.Content: We had a standard king room which we felt was a bit small by Marriott's standards. But it was still fine. Some grime on the bottom/floor shower door hinges. Waterproofing silicon over the bathtub, etc, was haphazardly done. All these are minor but we found it surprising & didn't seem fitting for a 5* establishment. The room had stationery items like post-it pads, paper clips & highlighters in a little drawer, which I thought was a nice touch, especially for the business traveler. Fruit on fruit platter gets replenished. As a lot of reviewers have said, very convenient location to the MTR, eateries & shopping. Just head to LG (Lower Ground) level from the lifts!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location: use train/bus fr airport”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoChilidog
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent: close to park and easy walk to Peak Lookout tram. Easy access to subway system. Breakfast buffet was wonderful; book inclusive rate with view, breakfast, & internet access. Note: future building may block lower level harbour view roooms! Request upper floors. Save some cab fare and take train to main station and free shuttle bus to JWM. Shopping in HK is not what it used to be: Very high and very low ends only. There's a food market in the lower level of Pacific Place next door to Marriott; good snack location. Very nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: TheGreatDane33
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying on the executive floor at J.W.Marriott in December 2009 and what a stay. From the moment I got out of the taxi there was people around me making me feel welcome. My luggage was taken care of right away as expected at a hotel of this standard and I was guided to the check-in. Here I was given the key to my room (3315) at the executive floor. Entering the room was a really nice surprise. Walking through the hall I had an amazing bathroom on the right hand side. On my left hand side there was what I would call a nice size walk in closet equipped with all kinds of things. Straight ahead was my corner room with a great view (not first row though) at Victoria harbour. The room had two amazing double beds, a huge flat screen TV, well equipped (and expensive) mini bar, a sitting area and a work table. Within 5 min. my luggage was brought to my room by a very friendly member of the staff. When staying at the executive floor you'll have access to the executive lounge. Here you can get free drinks, snacks, dinner and breakfast. It was a little crowded at times but the staff was professional and you've got free internet in the lounge (internet in the rooms are as all other Marriott hotels expensive) The location of the hotel is perfect as the metro station is located under the hotel. I will stay here again if I'm going back to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Nush7
Reviews.Content: Late review. It was good stay, nice pubs/bars and restaurants nearby. Dined at the hotel's Lounge restaurant with a view of the harbour - great views and laser show was a bit of a let down. Dinner was OK, not as great as expected but staff were extremely good.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service”
Reviews.Author: SeeingIsBelieving007
Reviews.Content: One of the top hotels on Hong Kong Island, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. Rooms were not huge but extremely comfortable. The service was excellent - enjoyed the small touches like being presented with a towel and bottle of water at the front door when returning from a morning jog. Nice enough bar downstairs, even if it is a popular place for local pick up girls. Located above Pacific Place shopping centre with shops, restaurants, a cinema and the MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Very average - not luxury”
Reviews.Author: Globaladventure
Reviews.Content: Marriott very much market their JW brand as luxury - this is more a standard Marriott experience, rather than offering anything memorable. Lets start with the positives. The hotel is well located, in the business district of Hong Kong Island, the Front Desk Team are freindly and professional and there is a great gym & pool for a city hotel. Beyond that, the rooms are very small - so OK if you are travelling on your own - but would be cramped if there were two of you. The rooms are designed to cram as much in as possible - an oversized desk, seperate shower in the bathroom, huge plasma screen etc... it would probably be better with a less is more approach. The restaurants are very disappointing. We dined in the JW Cafe, where I ordered a steak. If anything, I would expect that Marriott could get a steak right - it was probably the worst piece of meat I have ever had and it was sent back! The breakfast was also poor. A real lesson in quantity over quality. A very average and not a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay over Chinese New Year”
Reviews.Author: TravellingHoya
Reviews.Content: Spent two days in Hong Kong over Chinese New Year using hotel points. The hotel was lovely and met the high quality expectations we had for a JW Marriott. The location is great. While there aren't many sights in the immediate area, we were just 1-2 MTR stops from anywhere we wanted to go. As other reviewers have said, the room wasn't the largest. But what the hotel lacked in room size, it made up for in service and comfort. We were on the 22nd floor and had a mountain view. Considering the fog at the time, it didn't make sense to pay for a harbor view. I have Platinum status, so we had access to the Executive Lounge on the 25th floor. We ended up spending a lot of our hotel time here and found the Exec Lounge staff to be incredibly friendly and helpful. They helped us with travel arrangements, restaurant reservations and navigating the local transportation system. I would definitely stay at the Marriott on a return trip to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “You can always trust Marriott.”
Reviews.Author: reissaaja_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night in this hotel but it was like a heaven after two weeks of backpacking. Everything was so luxurious that we were amazed. The room was really nice and staff excellent. Even if we came to the hotel with our backpacks and not so elegantly clothed, they treated us as very valuable guests. I have nothing to complain about, the hotel was just like the five star hotel should be. And also the breakfast was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and smooth”
Reviews.Author: Askaplus3
Reviews.Content: We had to leave our baggage before check-in but everything was very smooth and they even took us to a room although there was more than 4 hours to check-in time. It was very nice. Concierge is very helpful as well. The pool is nice. Only think we could ask for is to bring a sauna to the same place as the pool and renovate the bathroom in the room.. Overall, a beautiful stay.

Reviews.Title: “my trip to hong kong”
Reviews.Author: BiancaT4
Reviews.Content: i went to hong kong on july 2009 and i stayed at the jw marriot hotel and that place was awesome,they hade a swimming pool and a hot tub

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: ShaneB4
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with great views across the harbour

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: RegularTraveller2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 weeks and had breakfast buffet included in the rate otherwise it would be very expensive for 2 adults and 2 children to eat breakfast every day. The breakfast buffet is fantastic and has everything you could want. Gym is well equipped with your own earphones/towels and flavoured water or bottled water. Saunas are in the changing rooms. Nice restaurants at bottom of hotel which leads straight into the shopping centre and the MTR so no need to go outside! We had a reasonably spacious room(Hong Kong Standard) with 2 double beds and a corner view of the harbour. The bedrooms with 1 double bed are compact with just enough room to walk round the bed. This is mainly a business hotel judging from the lack of families and children at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: aikoaikoallday
Reviews.Content: Please don't let the Marriott name fool you - this is a first rate luxury hotel in every respect. The staff is outstanding, and the rooms are clean and modern. The location is perfect, sitting both right above the best shopping in Hong Kong, and close to the office buildings. It's a 10 minute walk to the Bank of China building, a 20 minute walk ot Causeway Bay, and a short taxi ride to the Kowloon ferry (with the subway to Kowloon right below the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: alanr-co
Reviews.Content: The corner room had a large flat-screen TV, a nice view outside (including the pool), a large desk complete with tape, staplers, sticky notes, wired internet. I travel about half the weeks of the year, and this was the most useful room from a business standpoint that I've had. The internet wasn't free, but it did work well. The phone was even set up with my name on the display when I checked in - a nice touch. The large flat screen TV even tempted me to rent a movie - and the selection was good, and the picture and sound excellent. This is unusual for me - I usually don't even turn the TV on in a hotel room. The bed was comfortable, and all lights and curtains were controllable from the head of the bed - another nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business use”
Reviews.Author: Johnboyholidaykid
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights on business in October. I had a very nice, spacious corner room (regular - not a club room) and this was spotless with a large LCD TV / DVD player. Large comfy bed. Nicely located hotel very convenient for the metro and only 10 mins walk from Wan Chai, or the peak tram. Breakfast in the hotel is very good and there is also a nice spacious bar area (if expensive).

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Get Away from The Busy Pace of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: wavingclouds
Reviews.Content: We went there to watch the fireworks on the 60th anniversary of The PRC. The service as always was good. The food was excellent. The pool hidden from the busy area of town was a good relief and fun for my son. The hotel has always had good service. The room was small but fine. The Executive dining area was well done and had a good view.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: SFtraveler21
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is well located in Pacific place, and the rooms, though small, have recently been renovated. My only complaint is the internet charges. I received seven charges for three days on my bill. While this was corrected, I probably would not stay here again if they continue to charge for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “It's in the details!”
Reviews.Author: Mis_Adventurous
Reviews.Content: Our room was magnificent! We had plenty of space and well appointed bathroom. The staff were courteous and met all of our needs. With the exception of our "in room" movie not working properly, we had no problems. This was our fourth trip to HK and this hotel ranks best. The location (the Admiralty MTR station) and the Pacific Place Mall were amazing. We had access to several breakfast and lunch places and everything else we could access by public transport. We used the laundry service for some dry cleaning and everything came back in perfect condition. The beds were comfortable and the fresh fruit that was placed in our room each afternoon was a great perk!

Reviews.Title: “oooooh, i liked this one!”
Reviews.Author: redhedgurl5
Reviews.Content: i was scheduled to have surgery at matilda hospital on the peak and needed to come over a day early. i decided to stay at the marriott due to it's desirable location for this trip. and the location is AWESOME. this is the best spot in HK so far. it's attached to pacific place, which has a wonderful food shop in the basement of siebu. i was able to pop down there and get a great dinner. i loved the decor. it was all in warm, sunny golds and rust. in fact, it was like i had decorated it to my own tastes! the bathroom was nice, not as big or sumptuous as some marriott's, but space is at a premium in these locations. the room was very well stocked and very comfortable. they even had a drawer filled with paper clips, tape, sticky notes... very cool. bed was super comfy. much softer than many other asian beds. i slept great. over all, this was one of my better hotel experiences. marriott seldom disappoints.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to details was the added touch”
Reviews.Author: feaves
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the JW Hong Kong, for 4 nights on our way to Thailand. The hotel is among the best of the JW properties (the JW in Phuket has a long way to go to match this place). We were assigned a corner suite with a view of the harbor. The bed was a bit hard, the bathroom a bit on the smaller side, for a JW property, but the staff could not have been nicer. Free wifi in the lobby and conceirge lounge was a plus, especially if you use an iPhone to phone home via Skype. The location on the HK island side was great. The short walk to the efficient Admarlity station was great. Road Trams stopped outside the Pacific Place mall, attached to the hotel. The breakfast selections in the lounge were wonderful, we never left the hotel hungry in the morning. It suited our needs for the 4 short days in HK. The staff paid attention to the little things, and it showed.

Reviews.Title: “Great JW Marriott, Among the best”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Lving
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights here, and as a Platinum Marriott member, they really take good care of you. The hotel is in a great location in HK, with direct access to the Admiralty MTR station. You can literally be anywhere in the city in 20 minutes from that station. The views aren't the greatest from the hotel (I also stayed at the Renaissance Harbour for a few nights and the views there are much better). This is a much nicer hotel, however. It fits in well with the JW brand and really the only way to go to a higher class of hotel in HK is to pay MUCH more at a Four Seasons or Pennisula type hotel. Not worth it, in my opinion. Great access to local attractions, free WiFi in the lobby, recently renovated rooms, etc. I spent 75 nights a year at Marriotts, and this is among the best of them out there. On par or better thanLondon County Hall and Paris Marriott, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Super Nice View from our Room....I love it!”
Reviews.Author: Crisb_23
Reviews.Content: Nice service, Clean room, I love the automatic curtains in our room and the nice staff...

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience. But great location.”
Reviews.Author: Deep_Anchor
Reviews.Content: The best thing about JW Marriott is its location. With its basement access to the Admiralty MTR station you get direct connections to the Central MTR (which connects you to Lantau island and most of the other MTR lines) on the west and the Causeway Bay MTR (where all the great shopping lies) on the east. Plus, it is at a walking distance (5-10 minute leisurely walk through the Hong Kong Park) from the Peak Tram base terminal that takes you to the top of the not-to-be-missed Peak. The hotel is also attached to the very posh Pacific Place mall which gets you top-end designer labels, restaurants, a cinema theatre and even pharmacies. However, that's where the good things end and the nightmares begin. CONNED FOR A VIEW We had booked a three night stay in one of their deluxe rooms. On check-in we were told that they had a special offer running that would get us a newly renovated room with "spectacular views of the harbour" for just HK$300. We quite liked the idea and signed up for the same. Imagine our dismay when we realised that the hotel itself is not really "on" the harbour front. The view that our room offered was of a cluster of high-rises with the sea visible through the spaces between them. To add injury to the insult, we found that they had charged us HK$900 for the "view" and not HK$300 as promised. On enquiry they said that it was their per-night rate and not a gross figure. We should have read the fine print it seems. THE POTTY RUNNETH OVER As disgusting as that might sound, it is the most accurate description of the first morning we woke up at JW Marriott Hong Kong. Took a dump, tried to flush and ... well ... let's just say the waters just kept rising. After a messy ten minutes of trying to avoid a calamity, we called the maintenance guys who fixed it. Said that the cistern handle was broken and that the commode was choked as well. We have never experienced or heard of something like this happening in any five star luxury hotel in the world. ENGLISH ANYONE We understand that despite being a cosmopolitan city the general population of Hong Kong isn't too comfortable with English. That's quite acceptable when it comes to taxi drivers, shopkeepers and the average joe on the street. But when you are being served at the coffee shop of an international hotel brand like JW Marriott, it is simply unacceptable. Three out of five servers either couldn't comprehend or couldn't respond to simple requests like "could you get us some cold water?" or "is this vegetarian?" We finally had to wait for the Captain (the head steward) to serve us. However, even that was an ordeal in its own. Read on. CULINARY NIGHTMARE So we order a pizza at the coffee shop. When it arrives we see that it's not baked properly (the underside was still doughy!!) After spending a good two minutes in making the Captain understand what was wrong with the pizza, it's taken away. It is brought back overdone, almost charred. We decide not to push our luck and to try and have it. It tastes bad and we ask for some dried oregano. The Captain is stumped. "What is that?" he says. We finally write it down for him on a piece of paper. He leaves and comes back after five minutes and says that they don't have it. We ask for some Dry Chilli Flakes. He brings us red chilli paste. We ask for Tabasco. He gives us a blank look. We raise a white flag and surrender to the now cold pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, worth its value”
Reviews.Author: qtcupid
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel with a few friends during my stay here. we shared a room for two nights with two double beds. we loved the room, comfy beds, big bathroom, full amenities, large windows with amazing view, large tv. the room is kinda small for 4 ppl, but given that it is Hong Kong and every square footage is precious, we have no complains. the bathroom is luxurious with tub and shower stall, you can also listen to the tv from the bathroom. it is also located conveniently near a large shopping mall and access to the MTR. great for shopping and meeting up with friends. i heard the high afternoon tea at this hotel is popular and excellent, but didn't have time to try it out. i will definitely recommend it to others, and will stay again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - worth every penny !!”
Reviews.Author: RLAK
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my friends and there was nothing we could fault. We had breakfast everyday and it caters for everyones tastes. The serivce at breakfast was terrific as well. They offer a egg station so you can choose how to cook your eggs, fresh juice and smoothies both western and asian choices. The rooms were very comfortable, with big TVs, soft beds, big bathrooms, great views and most importantly CLEAN. The service from all staff was above 5 star especially the concierge team who helped alot. I would definately go back to this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Great deal - 3rd night free”
Reviews.Author: Sammy0809
Reviews.Content: My second time to stay at this hotel. This time, I reserved the room with hotel directly and were able to get a great deal (3 nights stay for the price of 2). I asked for a bigger room with nice view at checked-in, the receptionist was able to find a beautiful corner room on high floor for me.
