Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, 13 - 15 April, and were happy with the choice given Hong Kong's notoriously expensive hotel rates. We paid HKD$2,690 for 3 of us per night plus taxes. The room was very comfortable and the bathroom great. We had harbour views. The hotel is directly above one of the biggest and best shopping malls in Central. It is a bit of a walk to the nightlife area of Central and also to the Star Ferry or the transport terminal which is okay at this time of year before it gets too hot. The breakfasts are good without being spectacular. We were happy to stay here but would only choose it again if the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Marriott”
Reviews.Author: tahiti05
Reviews.Content: My husband had to go to Hong Kong for a quick trip on short notice and we decided to priceline a hotel in a central location. We got the JW Marriott for less than $200 which we thought was a great deal. We arrived early around 7am but was able to check into the hotel right away. We were even allowed to get credit on our Marriott rewards card. The front desk was awfully polite and check-in was swift. We got a room on a low floor but it had a nice view of the pool and we didn't mind. They brought us a plate of fresh fruit and chinese tea and there was free mineral water in the room. The room was a decent size, not too big but comfortable and the bathroom was spotless with separate bathtub and shower. The staff seemed to have a sixth sense of when we come and go because we never saw them but the room was always cleaned up quickly. One time we just went down to the gym for 20 mins but when we got back to the room, the room was already cleaned and spotless and the fresh fruit and bottled water was replaced every day (actually twice a day because they replace it at turndown service too). We thought that was quite generous of them. We didn't dine at the restaurants or use other facilities so can't comment on that. But overall the staff everywhere we encountered, from housekeeping to front desk to bell desk to concierge were extremely polite and friendly and we felt the hotel was in a perfect location to enjoy Hong Kong. It's great that it is located right in the middle of one of the best malls in Hong Kong too, with access to tons of nice shops and restaurants and easy access to the MTR underground and you never have to wait for a taxi anytime of the day. We'd defintiely come and stay here again if we can get a good deal again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: LesRostbifs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the J.W. Marriott for 7 nights on vacation. This is a magnificent hotel with lift access to one of the best and newest Shopping Malls in Hong Kong, from which have direct access to Admiralty MTR underground station. Having travelled extensively and stayed in many hotels classed as 'The Best in the World' the service and standard of accommodation in the Marriott equalled any. The hotel is within easy walking distance (15 - 20 minutes) of many bars, restaurants and other attractions. Alternatively, it is one stop on the MTR to Kowloon or Central. The only advice I would give someone staying is to make sure that the 'Do not Disturb' light is on when in the room as the staff like to make the rooms up early on a morning. Overall, fantastic service, excellent value for money. Book it and enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Even bettervalue-for-money than newcomer Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: MouMou
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 days at this hotel & moved to Four Seasons for 1 night to be nearer to the HK station. So I have the advantage of a direct comparison (please see my other review on Four Seasons). SERVICE. The service in this hotel is even better than Four Seasons. The staff is more experienced and confident. For example, I spoke to a concierge pertaining recommendations for a Chinese restaurant. The next day, when I was asking some other questions at the concierge, the previous day's concierge came over to asked if I had my previous day's search was resolved. I was impressed at his memory !! TECHNOLOGY. The curtains, doorbell, signages (eg. Do not disturb & Please make up room) are fully automated and can be activated at the press of a button. The digital clock is strategically positioned such that it's easy to glanced at when standing and from the bed. LOCATION. It's located at Pacific Place where you have access to Admiralty Station. Although the furthest hotel to the MTR (compared to Conrad & Shangri-la), it is still extremely convenient to the station as well as the mall. Considering I did not have a habourview room (compared to Four Seasons) for this stay, I still rate this hotel better value for money than Four Seasons. The Marriot's fruit tray has more variety compared to only apples at Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Bob-a-JobSussex
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here leaving on Christmas Day morning. We booked a JW suite with club accesss and we were delighted with both the room and the hotel. The club lounge comes in for special praise. The breakfast and snacks were excellent. We have been in many club lounges of different hotel chains over the last few years and this was the friendliest. The furniture was arranged to encourage interaction between guests and this enhanced our stay. We even exchanged email addresses with another couple. The staff were excellent and the suite very nice. Our only little niggle was the wardrobe which was very small and crammed up against the bedside table making it very difficult to access which was a bit strange in a suite. Otherwise we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would book again.

Reviews.Title: “The very best JW, outstanding services and location”
Reviews.Author: talltree123
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveler staying at hotels about 2 times a week every week. I have stayed at the JW and regular Marriot hotels throughout the world. The Hong Kong JW deserves the top rating for its accommodation, services, and location. I recently stayed at the HK JW Marriott hotel for 14 days on business. First, the executive floor manager gave me a complementary bottle of wine. In addition, the breakfast at the concierge includes both Asian and high quality Westin foods, with wine tasting once a week, afternoon snacks, great evening hot food and tropical fruits, and very decent chocolates all the way thru midnight. We even had a turkey meal on Thanksgiving at the concierge lounge. I also took a couple clients to the floor during one evening and was greeted by the staff with decent red wine for my guests. My clients were very impressed. The room was very clean, very QUIET (very important to me because I do not really get much sleep), and with tall glass windows I can see the beautiful harbor and the Peak. The swimming pool was heated so I swam there almost every morning, and the gym is also outstanding. The hotel is connected to the Pacific Place, which is my favorite shopping mall in HK. The MTR (subway) station is also a 3-minute walk thru the mall. Given my busy travel schedule, this great hotel with its excellent location and services is my top choice for Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Sophie_In_Taipei
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with great service: smiling reception staff, they even bring you to the elevator although you are a regular guest, they press the floor bottom for you wishing you a good stay, you have complimentary fruit basket and hot Chinese tea although you are just at the basic level of the Marriott membership (what a difference with the snobbish and bad service of the Grand Hyatt in Wanchai)... The gym is open 24h a day and the swimming pool closes at 23h. The breakfast is great with the huge selection of fresh juices and fruits you can bring along with you for the day. Great location as well with the MRT at the basement as well as plenty of restaurants and shops in the Pacific Place Mall (basement as well).

Reviews.Title: “loved the marriott”
Reviews.Author: wards
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is very much in the buisness sector,it is very well located for lesuire, go down to the ground floor the lift will take you to an amazing shopping centre and direct access to the M.T.R, the best underground system i have ever travelled on. As the hotel caters for a lot business men i felt prices in the hotel for breakfast although good was very high,but there is a very good starbucks over the road and a few good resurants in the shopping mall. Would i stay here again oh yes like a shot

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CooperSJCW
Reviews.Content: I stayed for five days, and the Marriott has been just excellent. Before making the reservation at the JW Marriott, I considered the Sheraton Towers and the Intercontinetal. Since I had some free time during my business trip, I was able to check out these two hotels, and let me tell you, the Marriott is way better than these two hotels. First of all, if you plan to be in HK Island, the Marriott is the perfect choice (Sheraton and Intercontinental are in Kowloon). Both the Sheraton and Intercontinental were very crowded, and the Marriott was just perfect. Great food, good room (Harbour view), friendly staff and very good looking hotel. I will definitely go back to the Marriott when I visit HK again.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: kizzypoo2
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Hong Kong and our second stay at the JW Marriott. What a lovely hotel. The views of harbor and Victoria’s Peak are unmatched; the service was impeccable. Though it can use a bit of updating, the rooms are large and comfortable and the location is beautiful. We highly recommend a stay at this gorgeous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small luxuries - big bargain”
Reviews.Author: RNL25
Reviews.Content: The J.W. was a very pleasant surprise. We expected a nice hotel, but we didn't expect it to be quite as nice as it was for the great rate we got on the Marriott website. From the moment you walk in to the marble lobby with the high ceilings and the great harbor view, you realize that you are at the Marriott's top-of-the-line. We had a great corner room with two walls of windows, a comfortable size with a large bathroom -- again, a surprise for the rate. The hotel had all the little luxuries you would expect from a five-star hotel, plush robes and comfortable slippers - which were replaced daily -- twice-daily maid service, and a welcome tea served on a lovely tea set. The business center had a nice refreshment area where you could have tea or espresso with steamed or chilled millk, and fancy meeting rooms if you actually needed to conduct business. The gym was shiny and modern with individual tvs on all the treadmills and bikes, and the buffet breakfast at the restaurant (again, included in our rate) had everything from 10 kinds of fresh fruit to made-to-order omelettes to dim sum. The staff in all locations were extremely friendly, helpful and solicitous. On one rainy afternoon we wondered if the hotel had DVD players available. Three minutes later, someone was setting one up in our room -- for no extra charge. I can't imagine needing anything else or getting better treatment at one of the higher rated -- and more expensive -- properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: happy_gypsie
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriot was in a very good location on Hong Kong Island. I am glad we stayed on the island instead of Kowloon. The island was much nicer and upscale. The hotel is attached to a mall and the train station, which makes it very nice and convenient. You could actually get to and from the airport by train without ever going outside. There are restaurants (both Asian and western) in this mall so you don't have to eat in the overpriced restaurants at the hotel. There's also a little grocery store in this mall that is fabulous. It's like an asian Whole Foods. The service was fantastic. They were very nice and accommodating here. The rooms are very clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “OK place - like Marriott, needs refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: ARK_Travelers
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several hotels in my life. The rooms weren't that clean, the non-smoking rooms were clearly smoking rooms, and they never removed the tea that was 3 days old in our room! I would try to avoid this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: JamieKate
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was great. From the friendly welcome, to the spacious well cleaned rooms to the super outside pool and convenient location, I have nothing to complain about. I stay in a lot of hotels for business and this is definitely one of the better ones. It is linked to a great shopping mall called Pacific Place, which if you don't want to eat room service, but can't be bothered to venture far has a downstairs areas with some restaurants (including Zen, which does superb dim sum) and also a cheaper more 'snack style' food court on the first floor. As for the hotel facilities there are a number of different restaurant areas to suit all budgets. The fitness facilities are good - there is a cardio area and the outdoor pool is heated so even in Feb. it was possible to swim in the evening. I was only staying in a bog standard double room, but there was a small seating area, desk and enough room to move around without feeling squashed. There are tea and coffee making facilities in the room which are free as well as a fruit bowl and bottled water, all included. When I arrived they bought up some tea to 'welcome' me and in all my contact with the employees from the gym, pool, front desk etc. I found them to be extremely helpful. When I left the hotel I asked for a taxi to the airport and the concierge told me how much it would cost and what my other options were if I wanted something cheaper, which was typical of the service I encountered - not snobby, but friendly and approachable. I would really recommend the JW Marriott if you are in HK for business, but it would also make a good place for a city break and would suit families too. I am not sure about it for a super luxury break - maybe some of the more expensive rooms have the wow factor as they are higher up, bigger etc. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: JDLChester
Reviews.Content: Amazing. We arrived at 7am & despite being fully booked the previous night they had a room cleaned & ready for us within the hour (no extra charge). Room was nicely furnished (a bit floral!) with a large clean bathroom. Breakfast is something else - huge choice of everything you could imagine & fantastic value. The hotel was spotless & constantly being cleaned. We were given a late check out & our luggage was stored safely as we had a late night flight. We had use of the gym facilities (shower etc) which provided robes, towels & toiletries before our flight home. Cannot recommend this hotel enough! Top tip is to visit the Peninsula hotel for afternoon tea & go to Sams tailors for a custom made suit or shirts.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel on HK Island”
Reviews.Author: ZSmythe
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the JW Marriott on 3 occasions now. The first time I joined my husband when he was on an extended business trip. They had given him a large corner room - great for a long stay and much bigger than average as we subsequently found out. Have never had a full harbour view but I don't see how it can beat the panaoramic mountain view available from the executive level floors (and probably a few floors below as well). Opening the electronic curtains whilst still in bed to see another sunny morning dawn over the Peak is superb - the greenery is amazing in such a built up city. The executive lounge is peaceful and offers a good range of free refreshments - afternoon tea is particularly good. Service is good in general, although my husband thinks it improves to very good if you are wearing a suit. The Concierge can provide coloured photocopies of maps for hiking and gave a couple of excellent restaurant reservations. I love the warm outdoor pool - even in Feb it's a treat and the jacuzzi is surrounded by plants and is even warmer. Swim surrounded by towering skyscrapers! Food is reasonably priced if you eat the buffets in the lobby lounge and Marriott cafe and is of good quality - seafood is fresh and well prepared. The buffet breakfast in the cafe is expensive but absolutely superb - one of the best I have experienced; you can order smoothies to your own specifications. Location is good for business on HK Island or for pleasure, being close to the park and the tram up to the peak.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Great Location”
Reviews.Author: northgang
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week stay at the JW Marriott - Hong Kong. Location and service were fabulous! Easy access to subway/underground and with a big Shopping Mall just downstairs. Room had two walls of windows and great view to the harbour. Bed was great like brand new. Fresh fruit, bottle water were replenished daily and tea was always available around 5PM. Breakfast is fantatisc with oriental and ocidental options. Previously I stayed at Mandarim Oriental which is algo great... but next time I will go again for JW Marriot
